member.name: T:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.Annotation
member.summary: The base class for annotations.

member.name: T:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.IAnnotation
member.summary: Interface for annotations which can be rendered on a chart.

remarks.p: A custom object implementing IAnnotation can be added to an UltraChart's Annotations collection, and thus be rendered on a chart like any other type of annotation object.
Alternatively, an IAnnotation object's RenderAnnotation method can be called from a custom layer, which would cause it to be rendered to the SceneGraph using the specified parameters for location.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.IAnnotation.RenderAnnotation(Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.SceneGraph,Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.Primitives.Primitive)
member.summary: Renders the annotation as a graphical element to the SceneGraph.

remarks.p: In this method body, the Primitives which constitute the annotation should be created and added using the SceneGraph.Add method.

This overload of the RenderAnnotation method will be called by the Annotation Layer when an annotation's Location has matched with a parent primitive. For example, if the annotation's Row and Column are the same as another primitive's, a parent primitive has been found for the annotation, and this method will be called.

If multiple parent matches have been found for a single annotation, for example if the annotation uses the -2 wildcard for its row and/or column property, a single annotation will match many parents and thus, this method will be called many times.

member.param: A reference to the SceneGraph, which contains a collection of Primitives to be displayed on the chart.
The parent primitive assigned to the current annotation.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.IAnnotation.RenderAnnotation(Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.SceneGraph,System.Drawing.Point)
member.summary: Renders the annotation as a graphical element to the SceneGraph.

remarks.p: In this method body, the Primitives which constitute the annotation should be created and added using the SceneGraph.Add method.

This overload of the RenderAnnotation method will be called by the Annotation Layer, with a Point provided as the basis for adding the annotation. This point will have been calculated by the Annotation Layer based on the property values specified by the Annotation's Location property.

member.param: A reference to the SceneGraph, which contains a collection of Primitives to be displayed on the chart.
The point provided as the basis for adding the annotation, as determined by the Annotation's Location property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.IAnnotation.Location
member.summary: Gets/Sets the location of an IAnnotation object. All annotations must be placed based on the Location specified by this property.

member.summary: Sets the reference to the chart component being used by this ChartLayerAppearance.
member.param: The chart component which should be used by this ChartLayerAppearance.

member.summary: Creates a new object that is a copy of the current instance.

remarks.p: This is not the Clone() method typically called by the chart core; it is only to implement ICloneable. This method will directly call the strongly-typed Clone() method of the Annotation.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.Annotation.ToString
member.summary: Returns a string that represents the current annotation.

remarks.p: Implemented in order for the collection editor to indicate the type of each Annotation in the list of annotations in the collection.

member.returns: A string that represents the current annotation.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.Annotation.GetRenderPointFromParent(Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.Primitives.Primitive)
member.summary: Gets a point for rendering an annotation upon the specified parent primitive.

remarks.p: Generally, a center point from the parent primitive is used. Inheritors can override this method to return a different point.

member.param: The parent primitive to get a single rendering point from.
member.returns: A point for rendering an annotation upon the specified parent primitive.

The component reference is actually not needed unless this collection is going to be viewed in a designer (like a properties grid) in conjunction with a particular UltraChart component.

member.summary: Class for annotations which look like rectangles, with optional text displayed inside.

member.summary: Interface for objects which provide PaintElements.

member.summary: BoxAnnotation constructor.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.BoxAnnotation.GetBoxSize
member.summary: Gets the size of the Rectangle which will represent this box annotation.

remarks.p: If the height and/or width properties are set to a neutral values (less than 0), this method returns an appropriate size for the box by measuring the string to be displayed in the box, using the font specified in the TextStyle. This size is then multiplied by an inflation factor (1.1) in order to provide spacing around the text.

member.returns: A Size object containing the Height and Width of the Rectangle which will represent this box annotation.

The parent primitive assigned to the current annotation.

member.name: T:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.ChartAppearance
member.summary: This is the base class for all UltraChart Appearance objects. These objects will be used to style the chart at design- and run-time by exposing properties of each chart drawing layer.

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.ChartAppearance.component
member.summary: This IChartComponent reference is used to inform the Chart component of any changes that require immediate attention (for example, redrawing or resizing of the drawing's layers).

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.ChartAppearance.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor.

remarks.p: This constructor only initializes the Property Out of Range field with the localized content.
It does not set the IChartComponent reference since that will be set at a later time when the Appearance object is 'set' into the Chart.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.ChartAppearance.#ctor(Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.IChartComponent)
member.summary: Constructor called when an IChartComponent reference is already known.
member.param: Reference to a concrete implementation of IChartComponent.

remarks.p: This constructor initializes the Property Out of Range field with the localized content and sets the IChartComponent reference at the time the Appearance object is instantiated.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.ChartAppearance.SetComponent(Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.IChartComponent)
member.summary: Sets the IChartComponent that this ChartAppearance represents the appearance of.

remarks.p: The specified IChartComponent will receive update notifications to repaint itself when UpdateAll is called unless the noUpdate flag has been set.
Often the represented IChartComponent cannot be ascertained at the time the ChartAppearance is first instantiated, so it may be set at a later time by means of this method.

member.param: An IChartComponent that this ChartAppearance represents.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.ChartAppearance.IsDirty
member.summary: Indicator for whether this ChartAppearance object has changed or not.
member.returns: True if the ChartAppearance has changed, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.ChartAppearance.SetDirty(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets or clears the dirty flag.
member.param: Pass true to indicate the ChartAppearance is dirty, pass false otherwise.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.ChartAppearance.SetNoUpdate(System.Boolean)
member.summary: This method sets the NoUpdate flag to the specified value and is used internally to avoid parent update notifications.
member.param: Whether to set this appearance property for no update

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.ChartAppearance.GetNoUpdate
member.summary: This method retrieves the current setting of the noUpdate flag.
member.returns: True if the noUpdate flag is set, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.ChartAppearance.UpdateAll(System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This method updates the Chart to resize and/or invalidate itself as directed. When invalidating, the invalidation is based on the Layer-level cache. Calling this method has no effect if the noUpdate flag has been set to true.
member.param: Should the component be resized?
Should the component be invalidated?

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.ITickmark.EnableTickAlign
member.summary: Determines whether or not this group of tickmarks is aligned at a value. In order to zero align enable this and set value of TickAlign = 0.0;

remarks.p: If True, a tickmark must be provided at zero, and tickmarks should deviate from zero at the appropriate interval.
If False, a tickmark should be provided at the set minimum, and tickmarks should increment at the appropriate interval.

member.name: T:Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.IProvidePrimitives
member.summary: Provides the Primitives objects representing chart graphical elements.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.IProvidePrimitives.GetPrimitiveFromRowColumn(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Type)
member.summary: Retrieves an object reference to a Primitive for the requested (row, column).
member.param: The zero-based index of the data row represented by the Primitive returned.
The zero-based index of the data column represented by the Primitive returned.
A requested Type to coerce the Primitive object into before returning it.
member.returns: A Primitive object representing the given (row, column) combination, or null if no such Primitive exists, or if the Primitive exists but is not of the requested primitiveType.

remarks.p: Advanced developers may use this method from the application-level to access individual shapes that are used to render the chart graphics. Changing the size and position of Primitive objects outside of UltraChart may affect the informational content of the chart rendered. When the primitiveType is specified, any non-null Primitive returned can be safely typecast to the Type requested.
After directly manipulating the Primitive objects returned by this method, the developer must call InvalidateLayers to refresh the chart image.

member.exception: Thrown when either of the parameters are negative.

member.name: T:Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.Layers.Area3DLayer
member.summary: The 3-D Layer responsible for composing 3-D Area charts.

remarks.p: The 3-D Area Chart is rendered similarly to the AreaLayer, except instead of flat translucent overlapping polygons, there are slabs. The thickness of the slabs depends upon the number of rows of data being plotted (one slab per row, with there being a fixed depth; therefore the more rows, the thinner the slabs are.)

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.Layers.ChartLayer.CalculateZeroLine
member.summary: Calculates the Zero-line data value for the floor or ground plane of the Chart.

remarks.p: Function calculating the data value corresponding to the proverbial floor (or ground X-Y plane in 3-D charts) of the chart. Developers' subclasses should then map this to a corresponding pixel-value on whatever axis is appropriate to their chart type using that IAdvanceAxis' Map function. An accurate zero-line prevents chart elements from floating above/below the floor or ground plane.
Calculation of the zero line is with regard to:

li.ul: Data value 0.0, if zero lies in data within the range of data.
The maximum data value, if all data is less than zero (negative or -ve).
The minimum data value, if all data is greater than zero (positive or +ve).

member.returns: The real world data value subclasses should map to screen coordinates representing the Chart's floor or ground plane.

member.summary: This member supports the charting internal infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.Layers.ChartLayer3D.InitAdvanceAxis(Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.AxisNumber,System.Double,System.Double,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates and initializes a new IAdvanceAxis object.
member.param: The Axis identifier (X, Y, X2, Y2 or Z.)
Maximum data value at the upper end of the Axis' ruler that translates into screenMax.
Minimum data value at the lower end of the Axis' ruler that translates into screenMin.
Maximum pixel location within bounds on the screen.
Minimum pixel location within bounds on the screen.
member.returns: An IAdvanceAxis object with a numeric ruler for translating real-word values into screen coordinates.

remarks.p: The reference returned will be to an object belonging to the current Chart's grid and having those characteristics as were defined by the chart's AxisAppearance object (axis type, logarithmic or linear base, range, etc.)

In 3-D chart types, the RangeType is honored on continuous numeric axes only to the extent of the highest and lowest data values in the Chart's data source. For example, if RangeMin is greater than the minimum value in the entire data set, worldMin, then the IAdvanceAxis returned will only have a RangeMin equal to the lowest data value in the Chart's data source.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.Layers.ChartLayer3D.CalculateInnerBounds
member.summary: Calculates the inner bounds as a 3-dimensional cube.

remarks.p: The inner bounds is the drawing area available for any child layers, stored in innerBounds. In the event of 3-D charting layers, this bounding region is a 3-dimensional cube.
Inheritors should override in their custom drawing layers to do any inner bounds calculations appropriate to their charting application.
The result of this calculation is maintained in the protected volume field available to subclasses.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.Layers.ChartLayer3D.FillSceneGraph(Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.SceneGraph)
member.summary: Adds graphical chart elements onto the scene graph for rendering in 3-D.

remarks.p: This method performs a commit of any preceding 2-dimensional Primitives onto the Chart bitmap, prior to the subsequent rendering of any 3-D objects over top of the bitmap.
Inheritors should call the base class implementation of this method and then provide any supplemental scene construction logic in their own Layer's overriden version of this method.

member.name: T:Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.Layers.SplineArea3DLayer
member.summary: The 3-D Layer responsible for composing 3-D SplineArea charts.

remarks.p: The 3-D Area Chart is rendered similarly to the SplineAreaLayer, except instead of flat translucent overlapping polygons, there are slabs. The thickness of the slabs depends upon the number of rows of data being plotted (one slab per row, with there being a fixed depth; therefore the more rows, the thinner the slabs are).

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.Layers.Hierarchical3DLayer.ValidateDataForChart
member.summary: Confirms data is in an appropriate format for a Bar Chart.

remarks.p: When a chart is a stacked bar chart, it cannot have both positive and negative data values. All data values must share the same sign. This does not apply to regular column charts, which can contain columns both left and right of the Y-Axis.
Subclass implementations should call the base class implementation, before adding additional data checks, and set dataIsValid appropriately if it hasn't already been set to False.

member.param: A scene graph to compose 3-D elements.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.Layers.Heatmap3DLayer.GetAltitudeColor(System.Drawing.Color,System.Drawing.Color,System.Double)
member.summary: Calculates the blended iso-color in the spectrum appropriate for any Y-data value (altitude or temperature) on the surface.
member.param: The starting color of the linear spectrum.
The ending color of the linear spectrum.
The altitude or temperature (Y data value).
member.returns: A blended color.

remarks.p: The same blended iso-color is always returned for a given data value, as long as the Color Model has remained constant.

Blending is performed through linear interpolation equally across the Red, Green and Blue portions of the spectrum. It is not possible for the color returned to vary in fewer than all three primary colors unless the value of the primary color is identical in startColor and endColor.
Any opacity (or alpha) value in the supplied colors is ignored. Instead, the AlphaLevel of the chart's ColorAppearance is applied.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.Layers.Heatmap3DLayer.ScaleColor(System.Drawing.Color,System.Drawing.Color)
member.summary: Calculates a color halfway between two colors.
member.param: A color.
Another color.
member.returns: A color halfway between both colors.

remarks.p: The color returned shall have the opacity (or alpha) value of color1.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.Layers.Heatmap3DLayer.ValidateDataForChart
member.summary: Validates whether the data meets the validity requirements for a 3-D Heat Map chart.

remarks.p: Implementers should override this method (being sure to call the base class implementation, if any) and add additional validity constraints when the base class implementation indicates the data may be valid.
Heat Map chart types require at least 2 rows and 2 columns, since this is the minimum amount of data necessary to plot a four-corner surface (with each corner affixed to the X- and/or Z- axes).

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.Layers.Heatmap3DLayer.FillSceneGraphNew(Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.SceneGraph)
member.summary: Fills the scene graph with the faces of the 3-D heat map based on chart data.
member.param: A scene graph to compose 3-D elements onto.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.Layers.BarLayer.ValidateDataForChart
member.summary: Confirms data is in an appropriate format for a Bar Chart.

remarks.p: When a chart is a stacked bar chart, it cannot have both positive and negative data values. All data values must share the same sign. This does not apply to regular column charts, which can contain columns both left and right of the Y-Axis.
Subclass implementations should call the base class implementation, before adding additional data checks, and set dataIsValid appropriately if it hasn't already been set to False.

member.returns: Text of an error message.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.Layers.BoxChartLayer.ValidateDataForChart
member.summary: Confirms data is in an appropriate format for a BoxChart Chart.

remarks.p: When a chart is a stacked column chart, it cannot have both positive and negative data values. All data values must share the same sign. This does not apply to regular column charts, which can contain columns both above and below the X-Axis.
Subclass implementations should call the base class implementation, before adding additional data checks, and set dataIsValid appropriately if it hasn't already been set to False.

member.name: T:Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.Layers.BubbleLayer
member.summary: Layer for rendering the BubbleChart.

remarks.p: This layer is instantiated by the chart infrastructure to process data. It adds Ellipse primitives to the scene graph. These then appear as bubble chart elements to the user.

member.name: T:Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.Layers.XYChartLayer
member.summary: Chart Layer used by charts which have two numeric axes, and exist in planar space based on X and Y coordinates.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.Layers.XYChartLayer.#ctor(Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.IChartComponent,Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.ChartCore)
member.summary: XYChartLayer constructor.
member.param: A reference to the chart component being used.
A reference to the chart core responsible for this layer.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.Layers.XYChartLayer.ValidateDataForChart
member.summary: Validates whether the data meets the validity requirements for an X/Y chart.

remarks.p: Implementers should override this method (being sure to call the base class implementation, if any) and add additional validity constraints when the base class implementation indicates the data may be valid.
X/Y charts require, at minimum, numeric columns for both the X and Y dimensions of the grid.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.Layers.XYChartLayer.SetupDataFilter
member.summary: Initializes a ChartDataFilter to be used for the data source. Only applicable when the given datasource can be transformed into a ChartDataFilter. This member supports the charting internal infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.

remarks.p: For charts that use the XYChartLayer, such as Scatter and Bubble charts, this method takes care of the settings for relevant columns, such as ColumnX and ColumnY properties.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.Layers.BubbleLayer.GetPE(Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.Primitives.Primitive,Infragistics.UltraChart.Data.Series.IDataPoint,Infragistics.UltraChart.Data.Series.ISeries,System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets a PaintElement for a Primitive using the given parameters.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.Layers.BubbleLayer.#ctor(Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.IChartComponent,Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.ChartCore)
member.summary: Creates a BubbleLayer for this IChartComponent.
member.param: The component that this layer belongs to.
A core instance.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.Layers.BubbleLayer.GetAppearance
member.summary: Retrieves a BubbleChartAppearance.
member.returns: Returns this component's BubbleChartAppearance object, or null (Nothing in Visual Basic) if it doesn't have one.

remarks.p: All layers override this method to provide their own Appearance object that will govern the scene's presentation. When this method returns non-null, it is safe to cast the resulting ChartAppearance object into a BubbleChartAppearance.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.Layers.BubbleLayer.SetupDataFilter
member.summary: Sets up the data filter.

remarks.p: This method encapsulates the default logic of assuming the first three numeric columns encountered are the ColumnX, ColumnY and ColumnZ columns. If a column containing string-typed data is found then it is used to populate the row labels.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.Layers.BubbleLayer.ValidateDataForChart
member.summary: Validates that the data is appropriate for a Bubble Chart.

remarks.p: Bubble Chart requires that there exist at least three numeric columns of data. The first two columns specify the X- and Y-coordinates at which to plot the bubble, while the third column, Z, specifies the radius of the bubble.
The effects of calling this method are internal to .

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.Layers.BubbleLayer.GetDataInvalidMessage
member.summary: Retrieves the message to display when data is invalid for this chart type.
member.returns: A string with a localized error message to display to the user.

remarks.p: Layers override this method to furnish the chart infrastructure with a localized text message to present the user when the data is invalid for this chart type.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.Layers.BubbleLayer.FillSceneGraph(Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.SceneGraph)
member.summary: Adds Bubbles to the Scene Graph.
member.param: A scene graph passed in to which graphical primitives are added.

remarks.p: All layers override this method to provide functionality specific to their presentation. This method should call its base class' FillSceneGraph method, and should then add graphical Primitive objects to the scene graph.
The implementation of this method adds Ellipse objects to the scene graph corresponding the the rows of data bound to this layer's chart component.

member.exception: Thrown when the SceneGraph object supplied is null.

A reference to core.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.Layers.ColumnLayer.ValidateDataForChart
member.summary: Confirms data is in an appropriate format for a Column Chart.

remarks.p: When a chart is a stacked column chart, it cannot have both positive and negative data values. All data values must share the same sign. This does not apply to regular column charts, which can contain columns both above and below the X-Axis.
Subclass implementations should call the base class implementation, before adding additional data checks, and set dataIsValid appropriately if it hasn't already been set to False.

member.name: T:Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.Layers.DrillLayer
member.summary: DrillLayer draws the Drill Back button, if active, in the upper left corner of the chart.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.Layers.DrillLayer.#ctor(Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.IChartComponent,Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.ChartCore)
member.summary: Constructor for DrillLayer using default properties for variables in the Drill Layer.
member.param: The IChartComponent on which the scene graph renders.
A reference to the ChartCore for data access, etc.

remarks.p: There is no initialization particular to the DrillLayer class. It would not, for instance, be useful to store the DrillDownAppearance settings of ShowButtons and Enabled here, since they can change at any time.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.Layers.DrillLayer.#ctor(Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.IChartComponent,Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.ChartCore,System.Drawing.Color)
member.summary: Constructor for DrillLayer accepts a color for the drill back button.
member.param: The IChartComponent on which the scene graph renders.
A reference to the ChartCore for data access, etc.
A System.Drawing.Color for the drill back button.

remarks.p: This initializes the DrillLayer's drill back button color. By default, the drill back button is always rendered at the top left of the Chart's grid region.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.Layers.DrillLayer.#ctor(Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.IChartComponent,Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.ChartCore,System.Drawing.Color,System.Drawing.ContentAlignment)
member.summary: Constructor for DrillLayer accepts a color and content alignment (other than top-left) for the drill back button.
member.param: The IChartComponent on which the scene graph renders.
A reference to the ChartCore for data access, etc.
A System.Drawing.Color for the drill back button.
A System.Drawing.ContentAlignment for the drill back button in relation to the center of the Chart's grid.

remarks.p: This initializes the DrillLayer's drill back button color, and it's position along the edge of the chart to one of eight possible alignments (the default is normally TopLeft.)

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.Layers.DrillLayer.GetAppearance
member.summary: Retrieves a DrillDownAppearance related to the DrillLayer.
member.returns: A ChartAppearance object (actually of DrillDownAppearance type.)

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.Layers.DrillLayer.FillSceneGraph(Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.SceneGraph)
member.summary: Implements the FillSceneGraph method of ILayer. The only graphical addition DrillLayer can make to the chart is the drill back button, if it is enabled.
member.param: The scene graph passed in. It is this method's responsibility to add primitives to the existing scene graph.

remarks.p: This implementation first calls the parent class implementation, if any, and then proceeds to render a drill back button box in the upper left corner of the chart's grid.

member.name: T:Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.Layers.GroupedLabelAxis
member.summary: Axis class to use for axes with labels arranged into series and items.

remarks.p: This axis class can be used for uneven or jagged sets of data, where each series does not necessarily have an equal number of items.
In order to use this axis class, an object implementing IProvideGroupedLabels must be provided using the GroupedLabelProvider property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.Layers.GroupedLabelAxis.BarHeight
member.summary: Height of each item on this axis, in pixels.

remarks.p: The term BarHeight is used for clarity in terms of a vertical axis, as in a bar chart. If this axis is a horizontal axis, this property should return the width of each item. If data elements other than bars are being used, this property should still return the height (or width) of each item. This property is used for sizing and spacing the labels and gridlines.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.Layers.HeatMapLayer.FillSceneGraph(Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.SceneGraph)
member.summary: Fills the Scene Graph with graphical chart elements for Heat Map charts.
member.param: A scene graph to compose chart elements onto.

remarks.p: HeatMapLayer FillSceneGraph uses the chart data to generate cells of various colors, each of which represents a value in the data.

Depending on the RenderQuality of the HeatMapAppearance, the cells may be divided evenly into multiple parts, which results in a "smoother" blending of colors. Separate primitives are used for each region of each cell in the Heat Map.

member.summary: Draws a heat map cell to the specified SceneGraph.
member.param: The SceneGraph to add the cell to.
A rectangle representing the bounds of the cell to be added.
Color to paint the top-left quadrant of this cell.
Color to paint the top-right quadrant of this cell.
Color to paint the bottom-left quadrant of this cell.
Color to paint the bottom-right quadrant of this cell.
Number of times to divide the current cell.
The row to assign this cell.
The column to assign this cell.
A reference to the X axis.
A reference to the Y axis.

member.summary: Gets the color to use at a given value for the Heat Map. The StartColor and EndColor must also be provided.
member.param: The Start of the Color Range for this Heat Map.
The End of the Color Range for this Heat Map.
The value, or altitude, to find a color for.
member.returns: The Color to be used for this altitude (data value) in the Heat Map.

member.summary: Gets a Color value in-between a given start color and end color.
member.param: Color at one end of the color range.
Color at the other end of the color range.
member.returns: A Color generated from the average Red, Green, and Blue values of startColor and endColor.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.Layers.HeatMapLayer.GetDataInvalidMessage
member.summary: Retrieves an appropriate message to display when data is invalid, based on the current Chart type.
member.returns: Text of an error message.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.Layers.HeatMapLayer.ValidateDataForChart
member.summary: Confirms data is in an appropriate format for a HeatMap Chart.

remarks.p: When a chart is a stacked column chart, it cannot have both positive and negative data values. All data values must share the same sign. This does not apply to regular column charts, which can contain columns both above and below the X-Axis.
Subclass implementations should call the base class implementation, before adding additional data checks, and set dataIsValid appropriately if it hasn't already been set to False.

member.name: T:Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.Layers.IconLegendLayer
member.summary: Layer that adds the Icons to the Legend.

remarks.p: This adds the icons that appear to the left of labels within the Legend box. This layer should only be composited onto the Scene Graph if the LegendAppearance property Visible is True. If no Legend is being displayed on the chart, the results of compositing this layer are undefined.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.Layers.IconLegendLayer.#ctor(Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.IChartComponent,Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.ChartCore)
member.summary: Creates an IconLegendLayer object for the specified IChartComponent.
member.param: A chart component implementation.
A core instance.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.Layers.IconLegendLayer.FillSceneGraph(Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.SceneGraph)
member.summary: Adds icons next to the Legend labels to the scene graph.
member.param: A scene graph to composite Primitives onto.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.Layers.IconLegendLayer.FillSceneGraphScatter(Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.SceneGraph)
member.summary: Adds Legend Icons specific to Scatter charts.
member.param: A scene graph to composite Primitives onto.

remarks.p: Scatter charts require special icon handling because they may plot series characters or special symbols to the chart that need corresponding entries in the Legend.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.Layers.IconLegendLayer.FillSceneGraphScatter3D(Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.SceneGraph)
member.summary: Adds Legend Icons specific to Scatter charts.
member.param: A scene graph to composite Primitives onto.

remarks.p: Scatter charts require special icon handling because they may plot series characters or special symbols to the chart that need corresponding entries in the Legend.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.Layers.IconLegendLayer.FillSceneGraphBubble(Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.SceneGraph)
member.summary: Adds Legend Icons specific to Bubble charts.
member.param: A scene graph to composite Primitives onto.

remarks.p: Bubble charts require icons that display a descending scale of bubbles (by radius value) in the Legend for visual comparison to the chart.

Since estimating bubble radius by eye may not be optimal for all users, developers are encouraged to use an alternative means of conveying precise radius values to the user. The ItemFormatString property of chart text (and tool tips) can be assigned the built-in label keyword, <DATA_VALUE_RADIUS>, to provide this functionality.

member.summary: This class keeps all methods and fields for Complex Path. Complex path is a pair of two curves which have to belong to two parallel planes. member.summary: Confirms data is in an appropriate format for a Column Chart.

remarks.p: When a chart is a stacked column chart, it cannot have both positive and negative data values. All data values must share the same sign. This does not apply to regular column charts, which can contain columns both above and below the X-Axis.
Subclass implementations should call the base class implementation, before adding additional data checks, and set dataIsValid appropriately if it hasn't already been set to False.

member.name: T:Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.Primitives.PrimitiveShape
member.summary: The base class for all primitives that have fill color, thickness, and line style.

member.name: T:Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.Primitives.Primitive
member.summary: Primitives are generic graphical objects representing a data point. They are rendered to the scene graph of the chart by one or more Layers.

remarks.p: The Primitive class is the base class of all other graphical chart elements. They make up the axes, labels, on-chart text, bars, columns and other entities that are presented to the user.
Each graphical chart is comprised of Layer objects that compose one or more Primitives (and any of its many subclasses) onto the scene graph, which is then rendered into the chart.
Developers have considerable flexibility in accessing and manipulating Primitives, particularly in custom Layer implementations, to add powerful new visual functionality to their chart applications.

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.Primitives.Primitive.AccumulatedElementsValue
member.summary: Accumulated value of elements.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.Primitives.Primitive.#ctor
member.summary: Constructor for constructing a default Primitive.

remarks.p: A Primitive created with this constructor belongs to no Layer.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.Primitives.Primitive.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.Layers.ILayer)
member.summary: Constructor for constructing a Primitive corresponding to a row and column in the chart data, and a specific layer implementation.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.Primitives.Primitive.GetPrimitives
member.summary: Retrieves other Primitives associated with this Primitive, if any.
member.returns: This method always returns null.

remarks.p: Primitives support being associated with other Primitives in arbitrary relationships.
Subclasses must override this method and provide state management for storing a list of Primitives if any containment relationship or affiliation exists.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.Primitives.Primitive.HitTest(System.Drawing.Point)
member.summary: Indicates whether a point location hits this Primitive.
member.param: Point location (such as a mouse click location) to test for a hit.
member.returns: This method always returns False.

remarks.p: When implemented by a subclass, this method indicates that the specified point is within the confines of this Primitive.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.Primitives.Primitive.IsMyChartAreaVisibleAt(System.Drawing.Point)
member.summary: Determines whether or not the ChartArea in which this Primitive resides is visible at the given location.
member.param: The location to evaluate, expressed as a point relative to the Control.
member.returns: True if this Primitive's ChartArea is visible at the given point, otherwise False.

remarks.p: Used for composite charts where a Primitive may not be visible because it is outside the bounds of its ChartArea.
This method requires that the Layer property of this Primitive is set, in order to reference the ChartComponent, ChartCore, and ChartType in context.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.Primitives.Primitive.Highlight(Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.SceneGraph,System.Drawing.Color,System.Drawing.Color)
member.summary: Adds highlighting onto the current Primitive.
member.param: A scene graph to add the highlighting Primitive to the foreground of.
A color to use as the outline of the highlighting Primitive, passed in based on the applicable chart appearance.
A color to use in solid filling the highlighting Primitive, passed in based on the applicable chart appearance.

remarks.p: Highlighting is performed by creating another Primitive object of the same shape and size as the current Primitive, and placing it in the foreground at the Primitive's current location. The colors that should be used for the highlighting are set by the developer in the Properties Editor for the currently active chart appearance.

When implemented by a subclass, this method allows the Primitive to create another Primitive of the same shape and size, and the specified color style configured by the developer, that highlights it. The implementation should add the highlighting Primitive to the passed in SceneGraph object.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.Primitives.Primitive.InsideRectangle(System.Drawing.Rectangle,System.Drawing.Point)
member.summary: Indicates whether a point is within a rectangle.
member.param: Specifies a rectangular region.
Specifies a point location.
member.returns: Whether the point location is within the rectangular region.

remarks.p: This auxillary method can be used for hit and edge detection.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.Primitives.Primitive.Row

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.Primitives.Primitive.Column
member.summary: Column from data model which represents this Primitive.

remarks.p: Primitives are initialized to the and Column of data elements that uniquely idenfity this graphical element in the chart.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.Primitives.Primitive.Value
member.summary: An object reference containing data pertinent to this Primitive.

remarks.p: This property can contain any object reference designating the source, target, or purpose of this Primitive. For example, the Value property can be used to hold an item being rendered. It can hold the value that should be displayed in a tooltip when a user hovers over the Primitive. It can supplemental information to construct an image map of the non-data elements of a chart.

The intent behind any data objects referenced by this property are dependent upon the that added this Primitive to the scene graph. Developers are cautioned only to manipulate the values of Primitives their user-defined layer implementation has assigned. The effects of changing the Value property on a Primitive created by the charting infrastructure are undefined.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.Primitives.Box.HitTest(System.Drawing.Point)
member.summary: Indicates whether a point location hits inside of this Box.
member.param: Point location (such as a mouse click location) to test for a hit.
member.returns: Whether point is inside of the Box, if the Box's property is set to include HitTest capabilities, otherwise False.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.Primitives.Box.Highlight(Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.SceneGraph,System.Drawing.Color,System.Drawing.Color)
member.summary: Adds highlighting onto the current Box.
member.param: A scene graph to add the highlighting Primitive to the foreground of.
A color to use as the outline of the highlighting Box, passed in based on the applicable chart appearance.
A color to use in solid filling the highlighting Box, passed in based on the applicable chart appearance.

remarks.p: Highlights the current Box by overlaying another Box of identical size, shape and location. The coloration parameters supplied to this method by the charting infrastructure correspond to the appropriate highlighting style established by the developer in the chart's appearance.

The fillColor specified may include an alpha (or transparent) component, allowing the original Box (and any adornments it may have, such as chart text) to be partially visible through the highlighting. When the fillColor is opaque, highlighting hides any adornments on the original graphical element.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.Primitives.Polyline.Chart
member.summary: Retrieves the ChartType in which this Polyline was drawn.
member.returns: The ChartType this Polyline was drawn in.

remarks.p: The requires all of its constituent Primitives to have the same ChartType as itself, therefore this method overrides the base behavior to update its child Primitives.
Primitives may become invalidated if the ChartType of the control has changed. Always call the Clear method of the SceneGraph prior to changing ChartType.

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.Primitives.PCaps.None
member.summary: Include this primitive in the Hit test.

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.Primitives.PCaps.HitTest
member.summary: Indicates this Primitive is included in Hit Testing for mouse events.

remarks.p: This Flag must be set to True if the Primitive is to participate in receiving mouse movement and click events.

Since events travel from the foreground of the scene into the background, the first Primitive signaled by hit detection as the recipient of an event is the only one to receive it. Primitives that were covered may not be notified of the event, even if their HitMe Flag was set to True.

member.name: T:Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.Primitives.Text
member.summary: Public class for storing information of data point rendered as generic graphical object.

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.Primitives.Text.bounds
member.summary: Bounding rectangle for this Text primitive.

remarks.p: Whether or not this field is null determines much about a Text primitive, like how wrapping or clipping or rotation occurs.
In the absence of a bounding rectangle (if this field is empty), a center point will be used for placement of this Text primitive, and things like clipping and wrapping are not possible.

member.name: T:Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.Primitives.Wedge
member.summary: Graphical object containing a description of a 2-dimensional wedge or sector.

remarks.p: This extends by connecting the endpoints of the arc subtending the to a center point (in the case of a pure wedge) or a center point out from the center (in the case of a sector). This creates a closed figure that is fillable.
Wedge objects are the representation of 2-dimensional pie slices (RadiusInner equals 0) or doughnut sections (RadiusInner greater than 0) in pie and doughnut charts.

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.Primitives.Wedge.Percent
member.summary: Percentage of an entire pie/doughnut that this slice constitutes.

remarks.p: Developers should not modify this value when it has been calculated by the charting engine.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.Primitives.Wedge.#ctor(System.Drawing.Point,System.Int32,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Creates new Wedge with the given parameters.
member.param: Center point of wege.
Radius of wedge.
Starting angle (in degrees).
Sweep angle (in degrees).

remarks.p: The arc is drawn from startingAngle to (startingAngle + sweepAngle). The startingAngle is measured clockwise from a 3 o'clock position.
To create a doughnut sector instead of a pie slice, set the property.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.Primitives.Wedge.#ctor(System.Drawing.Point,System.Int32,System.Single,System.Single,Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.LineStyle)
member.summary: Creates new Wedge with the given parameters.
member.param: Center point of wege.
Radius of wedge.
Starting angle (in degrees).
Sweep angle (in degrees).
Style of the wedge.

remarks.p: The arc is drawn from startingAngle to (startingAngle + sweepAngle). The startingAngle is measured clockwise from a 3 o'clock position.
To create a doughnut sector instead of a pie slice, set the property.

member.returns: True if the point is within this Wedge, False otherwise.

member.summary: Utility function for converting degrees to radians.

member.summary: Inner radius of sector (in pixels).

remarks.p: For a pie slice the InnerRadius should always be 0, while for a doughnut sector it should be greater than 0 but less than .

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.Util.Platform.GetStringSizePixels(System.String,System.Drawing.Font)
member.summary: Gets the size of a specified string using a specified font.
member.param: The string to measure.
The font to use when measuring the string.
member.returns: A SizeF object containing the height and width of the string.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Core.Util.Platform.GetLabelSizePixels(System.String,Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.LabelStyle)
member.summary: Gets the size of a specified string using a specified LabelStyle.
member.param: The string to measure.
The LabelStyle object to use when measuring this string.
member.returns: A SizeF object containing the height and width of the label.

remarks.p: Unlike the GetStringSizePixels method, this method accounts for the Orientation property of the given LabelStyle object, which affects how high or wide a label will be.
For example, a string+font measured at 50x100 pixels (HxW), but oriented vertically, would yield a SizeF of 100x50 using this method.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Data.ChartDataAdapter.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a Chart Data Adapter with default properties.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Data.ChartDataAdapter.CreateAdapter(System.Object,System.String,System.Windows.Forms.BindingManagerBase,System.String)
member.summary: Factory method for creating IChartData implementations.
member.param: The data source (DataTable, DataView, ICollection or string filename).
The name of a DataTable in the DataSource for charting.
Identity of a CurrencyManager to use when binding and staying current with the DataSource.
Name of the relation.
member.returns: An ChartDataAdapter that can be used as an IChartData implementation.

remarks.p: Please see the interface for more information.
An adapter can be automatically generated for an XML document represented in a string filename provided as the data argument. The following must be true:

li.ul: The filename must exist on the file system, end in ".xml".
The account under which the application is running must have permission to read the file.
The XML document must contain an embedded, strongly-typed schema.
It must be a conformant XmlDataDocument, with msdata:IsDataSet attribute set to true.

remarks.p: This method can also furnish an adapter when data is a System.IO.StreamReader containing comma-separated values (CSV).

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Data.ChartDataAdapter.SetZeroAlignment(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the Zero-Alignment of the ChartDataAdapter.

remarks.p: This is the preferred means for clients to access the state of the .

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Data.ChartDataAdapter.calculateMinMax
member.summary: Calculates the minimum and maximum values present in the data source.

remarks.p: The calculateMinMax method is called by subclasses when is suspected. It calculates minimums and maximums of numeric data only, tabulated by row and column.
It additionally adjusts and to handle zero-alignment transparently. If the state of zero-alignment changes, then the min/max state should be assumed to be stale.
Following a call to calculateMinMax, staleMinMax will be false.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Data.ChartDataAdapter.calculateMinMax(System.Boolean)

member.param: Whether or not to treat null values as zero.

member.name: T:Infragistics.UltraChart.Data.ChartDataFilter
member.summary: The primary purpose of this class is to allow the skipping of columns data from IChartData We need to ignore any columns that are of an invalid data type We also need to skip over the column that is the row label strings The drawing layers will get the IChartData Filter pointer to use instead of the Raw Data The column count and data gets and calcs will be accurate for this data subset

member.name: T:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.AppearanceHelper
member.summary: The base class for auxillary Appearance objects with members that notify parent Appearance objects of changes.

remarks.p: This base class defines the members for notification of parent Appearance objects about any changes in descendant Appearance objects.

AppearanceHelper should not be treated as a subclass of ChartAppearance because these types serve different purposes. AppearanceHelper does not know how to set properties in the associated chart layers. The Appearance objects derived from ChartAppearance contain this logic.
Developers should not find it necessary to use this class in their own applications.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.AreaChartAppearance.NullHandling
member.summary: Specifies whether nulls in the data are treated as zero or an average of adjacent values.

remarks.p: This property specifies whether null data encountered in the bound data source should be treated as having a zero value, or an average value of the adjacent data points.
See the enumeration for the values that indicate how nulls are handled.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.AreaChartAppearance.ChartText
member.summary: Exposes the collection of ChartTextAppearance objects.

remarks.p: This property exposes an enumerable collection of objects, each of which represents one or more chart text labels that may apply to each data point in the Area Chart. This property is read-only so it is not possible to change out an entire collection of ChartTextAppearance objects at once. ChartTextAppearance objects must instead be added and removed using the functionality of the class.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.AxisAppearance.RangeType
member.summary: Adjusts how the range of this Axis will be calculated.

remarks.p: This is an enumerated property that determines how the upper and lower bound of this Axis is calculated. See AxisRangeType for details of this property's possible settings.
For backward compatibility, this property defaults to AxisRangeType.Automatic.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.AxisAppearance.RangeMin
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum limit (or index) of this Axis' range.

remarks.p: For continuous axes this property allows a developer to specify the lower limit of this Axis' range. If the axis is discrete (dates, series-grouping, etc) then this allows the developer to specify the minimum row (or column, depending on chart type) index to plot.

The value for the lower limit of the axis must be a positive number when the is Logarithmic. If the RangeMin is greater than or equal to RangeMax, then the results of applying this range are undefined.
This property is ignored when is not set to Custom.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.AxisAppearance.RangeMax
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum limit (or index) of this Axis' range.

remarks.p: For continuous axes this property allows a developer to specify the upper limit of this Axis' range. If the axis is discrete (dates, series-grouping, etc) then this allows the developer to specify a maximum row (or column, depending on chart type) index to plot.

The value for the upper limit of the axis must be a positive number when the is Logarithmic. If the RangeMax is less than or equal to the RangeMin, then the results of applying this range are undefined.
This property is ignored when is not set to Custom.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.AxisAppearance.NumericAxisType
member.summary: Gets or sets this Axis to linear, logarithmic or an itemized (discrete) scale.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.AxisAppearance.LogBase
member.summary: Gets/Sets Log base of log axes.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.AxisAppearance.Margin
member.summary: Contains properties which affect axis margins. Axis margins are the space allocated on each end of an axis where data is not plotted.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.AxisAppearance.ScrollScale
member.summary: Gets/Sets Scrolling and Scalling property of the Axis.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.AxisAppearance.Visible
member.summary: Toggles the visibility of a chart axis.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.AxisAppearance.LineThickness
member.summary: Returns or sets a value that determines the thickness of an axis line, in pixels.

remarks.p: This property determines how thick the axis line is drawn.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.AxisAppearance.LineEndCapStyle
member.summary: Returns or sets a value that determines the style of the end of an axis line.

remarks.p: This property determines the end cap style of the axis line.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.AxisAppearance.LineDrawStyle
member.summary: Returns or sets a value that determines the style of an axis line.

remarks.p: This property determines the drawing style of the axis line.
The property specifies the thickness of an axis line.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.AxisAppearance.MajorGridLines
member.summary: Returns a reference to or sets the object that specifies the appearance of an axis' major grid lines.

remarks.p: The property specifies the appearance of an axis' minor grid lines.

member.summary: Returns a reference to or sets the object that specifies the appearance of an axis' major grid lines.

remarks.p: The StripLines property specifies the appearance of an axis' minor grid lines.

remarks.p: The property specifies the appearance of an axis' major grid lines.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.AxisAppearance.TickmarkStyle
member.summary: This property determines where tickmarks are placed.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.AxisAppearance.TickmarkPercentage
member.summary: Specifies how often to place tick marks and labels along a chart axis as a percentage of the axis data range when AxisTickStyle is set to Percentage. The value specified is outside the range of valid values.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.AxisAppearance.TickmarkInterval
member.summary: Specifies how often to place tick marks and labels along a chart axis as numeric data value when AxisTickStyle is set to DataValue.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.AxisAppearance.Extent
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the breadth of any margin between an Axis and the edge of the Control, in pixels.

remarks.p: Extent may have a value between 0 and 500. It is not strictly a margin, since labels are rendered in area created by an Extent. Setting the Extent to too small a value will result in labels for that axis appearing clipped.
Extent is ignored for the axes of 3D charts, it applies to 2D charts only.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.AxisAppearance.LineColor
member.summary: Returns a reference to or sets a Color object that specifies the color of an axis line.

remarks.p: This property specifies the color with which to draw the axis line.

member.summary: Returns a reference to or sets the object that specifies the appearance of the labels on an axis.

member.summary: Repository for default settings by chart and by axis.

member.summary: Gets/Sets the Orientation angle of the label text.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.AxisLabelAppearanceBase.Flip
member.summary: Returns or sets a Boolean value that determines whether label text is flipped. Only effective when Orientation is set to Custom.

remarks.p: True to indicate label text flipped; otherwise, False.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.AxisLabelAppearanceBase.LabelStyle
member.summary: Contains several properties related to the appearance of axis labels.

remarks.p: Set properties under LabelStyle for an individual axis to control things like font, orientation, and visibility of the axis labels.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.AxisLabelAppearanceBase.Visible
member.summary: Returns or sets a Boolean value that determines whether label text is shown or not.

remarks.p: True to indicate label text is shown; otherwise, False.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.AxisLabelAppearanceBase.Font
member.summary: Returns a reference to or sets a Font object that specifies the font used for label text.

remarks.p: The property specifies the color of the font used for label text.
The property determines whether the size of the font should be selected automatically.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.AxisLabelAppearanceBase.FontColor
member.summary: Returns a reference to or sets a Color object that specifies the color of the label text.

remarks.p: The property specifies the font used for label text.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.AxisLabelAppearanceBase.WrapText
member.summary: Returns or sets a Boolean value that determines whether label text is wrapped onto multiple lines if necessary.

remarks.p: True to indicate that label text that does not fit will be wrapped onto multiple lines; otherwise, False.
The property determines whether label text will be clipped.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.AxisLabelAppearanceBase.HorizontalAlign
member.summary: Returns or sets a value that specifies the horizontal alignment of label text. This property affects axis labels only when the Orientation property is set to Custom.

remarks.p: The property specifies vertical alignment of label text.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.AxisLabelAppearanceBase.VerticalAlign
member.summary: Returns or sets a value that specifies the vertical alignment of label text. This property affects axis labels only when the Orientation property is set to Custom.

remarks.p: The property specifies horizontal alignment of label text.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.AxisLabelAppearanceBase.ClipText
member.summary: Returns or sets a Boolean value that determines whether label text will be clipped if there is not enough space for it.

remarks.p: True to indicate that label text that does not fit is clipped; otherwise, False.
The property determines whether label text will be wrapped.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.AxisLabelAppearanceBase.Orientation
member.summary: Retrieves the value describing the orientation of labels on this axis.
member.value: The TextOrientation for the individual labels along this Axis.

remarks.p: This property controls the direction of label text (horizontal or vertical, and if vertical, the facing of the text).
An orientation can only be applied to labels on 2-D chart types.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.AxisLabelAppearanceBase.FontSizeBestFit
member.summary: Returns or sets a Boolean value that determines whether the font size of label text is selected automatically.

remarks.p: If this property is set to True, the font size of label text is calculated to best fit the alloted space; otherwise, the size specified by the property is used.
The property specifies the color of the font used for label text.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.AxisLabelAppearanceBase.ReverseText
member.summary: Determines whether or not the labels text should be reversed.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.AxisLabelAppearanceBase.Layout
member.summary: Contains settings determining how axis labels should be arranged.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.AxisLabelAppearance.ItemFormat
member.summary: Returns or sets a value that specifies the pre-defined format to use for label text for items.

remarks.p: The property can be set to select a custom format. If the ItemFormatString property is set, this property will be set to Custom.
The property specifies the pre-defined format to use for label text for series.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.AxisLabelAppearance.ItemFormatString
member.summary: Returns or sets a string of text that specifies the custom format of label text for items.

remarks.p: This property specifies a custom format for item labels. The property can be used to select a pre-defined format. If this property is set, the ItemFormat property will be set to Custom.
Please see the "String Formats" topic of the UltraChart help or the for the appropriate values of this property.
The property specifies the custom format of label text for series (group) items.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.AxisLabelAppearance.SeriesFormat
member.summary: Returns or sets a value that specifies the pre-defined format to use for label text for series.

remarks.p: The property can be set to select a custom format. If the SeriesFormatString property is set, this property will be set to Custom.
This property is ignored for 3D charts.
The property specifies the pre-defined format to use for label text for items.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.AxisLabelAppearance.SeriesFormatString
member.summary: Returns or sets a string of text that specifies the custom format of label text for series.

remarks.p: This property specifies a custom format for series labels. property can be used to select a pre-defined format. If this property is set, the SeriesFormat property will be set to Custom.
The property specifies the custom format of label text for items.
Please see the "String Formats" topic of the UltraChart> help for the appropriate values of this property.
This property is ignored on 3D charts.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.BarChart3DAppearance.BarSpacing
member.summary: Gets/Sets the value specifying an amount of space between each bar in a series, in whole bar width increments.

remarks.p: This property is present for inheritance by the BarChartAppearance class for use in Bar and Stacked Bar charts, it does not apply to 3-D chart types.
BarSpacing determines how much space is placed between bars. The value is specified in whole bar width increments. The space will always by a multiple of the width of a bar.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.BubbleChartAppearance.ColorCueColumn
member.summary: Returns or sets a value that specifies the absolute index of the column used for a Bubble chart's bubble color.

remarks.p: This property is zero based, meaning that the absolute index of the first column is 0.
The property specifies the index of the column used for bubble radius calculations.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.BubbleChartAppearance.ColumnX
member.summary: Returns or sets a value that specifies the absolute index of the column used for a Bubble chart's X-axis values.

remarks.p: This property is zero based, meaning that the absolute index of the first column is 0.
The property specifies the index of the column used for the Y-axis values.
The property specifies the index of the column used for bubble radius calculations.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.BubbleChartAppearance.ColumnY
member.summary: Returns or sets a value that specifies the absolute index of the column used for a Bubble chart's Y-axis values.

remarks.p: This property is zero based, meaning that the absolute index of the first column is 0.
The property specifies the index of the column used for the X-axis values.
The property specifies the index of the column used for bubble radius calculations.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.BubbleChartAppearance.ColumnZ
member.summary: Returns or sets a value that specifies the absolute index of the column used for a Bubble chart's radius calculations.

remarks.p: This property is zero based, meaning that the absolute index of the first column is 0.
The and properties specify the index of the column used for the X- and Y-axis values, respectively.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.BubbleChartAppearance.BubbleShape
member.summary: Shape of the Primitive used as a bubble.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.BubbleChartAppearance.NullHandling
member.summary: Indicates whether any Null data values encountered are to be handled as zero or the average value of adjacent rows.

remarks.p: This property specifies whether null data has to be handled as Zero or Average value

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.BubbleChartAppearance.SortByRadius
member.summary: Enables sorting bubbles by radius.
member.returns: Whether sorting is performed in an ascending or descending direction, or not at all.

remarks.p: This property provides developers an automatic option for controlling the foreground or background placement of bubbles within the scene graph rendered for Bubble Chart.
When large-radius bubbles tend to cover smaller-radius bubbles, then setting this property to Descending should alleviate that problem.

For backwards compatibility, the default value of this property is None. Developers can exercise control over the placement of bubbles within the chart by externally sorting it on any arbitrary criteria (including radius) such that data points that are desired in the foreground occur last in the data set.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.BubbleChartAppearance.ChartText
member.summary: Exposes the collection of ChartTextAppearance objects.

remarks.p: This property exposes an enumerable collection of objects, each of which represents one or more chart text labels that may apply to each data point on the Bubble Chart. This property is read-only so it is not possible to change out an entire collection of ChartTextAppearance objects at once. ChartTextAppearance objects must instead be added and removed using the functionality of the class.

Developers may have noticed that since each bubble on the Bubble Chart corresponds to exactly one row (with three columns making up the bubble's X, Y and radius), it is not necessary to specify a Column value when initializing the ChartTextAppearance objects for a BubbleChart. Bubbles can be identified by their Row only.

member.name: T:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.ChartGridAppearance
member.summary: A base class containing the shared feature set for any Chart grid associated with AxisAppearance objects that represent one or more axes (X-, Y-, Z-, second X-, and second Y-Axis.)

remarks.p: This class contains the shared objects for charts that are represented on a grid of multiple axes (anywhere from Cartesian plane to sophisticated multi-dimensional charting).

In general, only hybrid charts make use of the - and -Axes, although they can be implemented to add additional scaling features to a chart (for instance, imagine a Y2-Axis that can scale bubble size on a BubbleChart).

member.summary: Returns a string representation of the current instance.

remarks.p: Some objects do not have values that can be converted to a string. In these cases, an empty string is returned.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.ChartGridAppearance.ShouldSerializeBackColor
member.summary: Indicates whether the property is not set to it's default value.

remarks.p: This method returns True when the background plane color property is not set to its default value and needs to be serialized; otherwise, it returns False.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.ChartGridAppearance.ResetBackColor
member.summary: Resets the property to its default value.

remarks.p: Invoke this method to reset the BackColor property to its default value.
Once this method is invoked, the method will return False until the BackColor property is again changed.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.ChartGridAppearance.Reset
member.summary: Resets this object to its default state.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.ChartGridAppearance.PE
member.summary: PaintElement used for filling the chart grid area.

remarks.p: In charts with both X and Y axes, the square area adjacent to where these axes meet is known as the "chart grid." In both composite and non-composite charts, a PaintElement object is provided to customize the appearance of this area. For non-composite charts, use the Axis.PE property. For composite charts, use the chartArea.GridPE property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.ChartGridAppearance.X
member.summary: Returns a reference to or sets the object that specifies the appearance of the X-axis of a chart.

remarks.p: This property is ignored by charts that do not support an X-axis.
The and properties set the appearance of the Y- and Z-axes, respectively.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.ChartGridAppearance.Y
member.summary: Returns a reference to or sets the object that specifies the appearance of the Y-axis of a chart.

remarks.p: This property is ignored by charts that do not support a Y-axis.
The and properties set the appearance of the X- and Z-axes, respectively.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.ChartGridAppearance.Y2
member.summary: Returns a reference to or sets the object that specifies the appearance of the second Y-axis of a chart.

remarks.p: This property is ignored by charts that do not support a second Y-axis (in general, non-hybrid charts).
The , and properties set the appearance of the X-, X2- and Z-axes, respectively.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.ChartGridAppearance.X2
member.summary: Returns a reference to or sets the object that specifies the appearance of the second X-axis of a chart.

remarks.p: This property is ignored by charts that do not support a second X-axis (it applies to hybrid charts only, in general).
The , and properties affect the appearance of the Y-, Y2- and Z-axes, respectively.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.ChartGridAppearance.Z
member.summary: Returns a reference to or sets the object that specifies the appearance of the Z-axis of a chart.

remarks.p: This property is ignored by charts that do not support an Z-axis (2-D charts ignore this axis.)
The and properties set the appearance of the X- and Y-axes, respectively.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.ChartGridAppearance.Z2
member.summary: Returns a reference to or sets the object that specifies the appearance of the Z-axis of a chart.

remarks.p: This property is ignored by charts that do not support an Z2-axis (2-D charts ignore this axis.)
The and properties set the appearance of the X- and Y-axes, respectively.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.ChartGridAppearance.BackColor
member.summary: In 3-D charts only, this color is used to applied to the backplanes.

member.summary: Gets or sets the legend item. Legend item can represent a Data Point or a Series. For example, Pie chart needs legend item for every data point. The most of chart types use one legend item per series.

member.summary: List containing the keys of the Series which are consumed by this Layer.

remarks.p: This property is intended to support the charting infrastructure and ensure proper serialization of charts created using the collection editors, designers, and the chart wizard. Setting this property in code is not recommended.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.ChartLayerAppearance.SwapRowsAndColumns
member.summary: Value indicating whether Series should be swapped with DataPoints.

remarks.p: When this property is set to true, the Series collection will be flipped "sideways." DataPoints at the same index in consecutive series will be treated as if they were in the same series.

member.name: T:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.ChartTextAppearance
member.summary: An Appearance object that represents how an individual on-chart text label is presented.

remarks.p: These objects often appear collectively within the ChartText property of the control. In order to properly initialize a ChartTextAppearance object for display, the following properties must be set:

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.ChartTextAppearance.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a ChartTextAppearance object with the default properties.

remarks.p: Use this constructor when instantiating chart text objects without values. Developers must set at least the following properties before this chart text appears on the chart:
See the class for more information on interacting with the collection of chart text objects associated with a Chart.
