member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.ScatterChartAppearance.NullHandling
member.summary: Specifies whether nulls in the data are treated as zero or an average of adjacent values.

remarks.p: This property specifies whether null data encountered in the bound data source should be treated as having a zero value, or an average value of the adjacent data points.
See the enumeration for the values that indicate how nulls are handled.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.ScatterChartAppearance.ConnectWithLines
member.summary: Flag indicates whether scatter points are connected with lines.

remarks.p: When set to true, lines connecting each scatter point are drawn in the order the scatter points appear in the data source. If the lines do not connect the scatter points in the way expected, confirm that the data points have been properly ordered before charting.
This property can be employed by developers that require ScatterChart to appear as a line-equivalent chart with two continuous axes (since LineChart by definition has a discrete X-Axis).

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.ScatterChartAppearance.Icon
member.summary: Retrieves an enumeration which determines what SymbolIcon to use when rendering each scatter plot series.

remarks.p: The Icon property identifies an icon that is plotted by-series of scatter points. The icon can be one of several shapes, or letters.

When this property is set to Character, each scatter point will be displayed as specified by the property. If there are more scatter points than the number of potential characters, then characters will be reused.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.ScatterChartAppearance.IconSize
member.summary: Determines the size of the SymbolIcon to render for each data series.

remarks.p: If IconSize is set to Auto then UltraChart automatically chooses a size based on the number of points that are being plotted.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.ScatterChartAppearance.Character
member.summary: Specifies the individual Character to render for each scatter point.

remarks.p: This property is only used when is set to Character.
If there is more than one series of data (see GroupByColumn) then the char used for each series of data will be incremented starting with this property value.
When the selected character is a Unicode glyph, it is the developer's responsibility to ensure that the character code is represented in the selected, otherwise the results are undefined.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.ScatterChartAppearance.CharacterFont
member.summary: Specifies the Font of the Character to use to render each Scatter point.

remarks.p: This property only applies when is set to Character.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.ScatterChartAppearance.UseGroupByColumn
member.summary: Specifies whether the chart will use the GroupByColumn.

remarks.p: See the property for more information.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.ScatterChartAppearance.GroupByColumn
member.summary: Specifies a zero-based index of the data column used when grouping data into scatter series.

remarks.p: This property is ignored when the property has been set to False.
When using the Series collection, GroupByColumn is not used; instead, just add more than one XYSeries to the chart, and each XYSeries represents a grouped series of points.
The column specified must contain a set of repeating, numeric values that are used to group each set of data points into a series of related scatter points.
A different Character or SymbolIcon (based on the setting of ) is used to render each data series related by this grouping column.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.ScatterChartAppearance.ColumnX
member.summary: Gets/sets the column index to be used for X-Axis values when rendering a Scatter Chart.

remarks.p: This property can be used to specify which column in the data will be rendered along the horizontal X-Axis of the Scatter Chart. The column index is zero-based (i.e., the first column is at index 0).

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.ScatterChartAppearance.ColumnY
member.summary: Gets/sets the column index to be used for Y-Axis values when rendering a Scatter Chart.

remarks.p: This property can be used to specify which column in the data will be rendered along the Y-Axis of the Scatter Chart. The column index is zero-based (i.e., the first column is at index 0).

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.ScatterChartAppearance.LineAppearance
member.summary: Gets the SplineAppearance object, which determines the tension of the lines connecting scatter points.

remarks.p: Developers may apply smoothing to the connecting lines (when is True), by specifying a spline tension value greater than 0.0 on the SplineTension property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.ScatterChartAppearance.ChartText
member.summary: Collection of Chart Text objects that can be displayed onto this Scatter Chart.
member.value: A reference to the of the current Scatter Chart.

remarks.p: Developers can Add instances of the class to this collection to cause supplemental text labels to be rendered within the charting grid area beside chart elements.

member.summary: Returns or sets a Boolean value that indicates whether or not the data points between plotted line segments are displayed in the Radar Chart.

remarks.p: This property specifies whether to show the data points between line segments. Normally line segments join each other smoothly to form a continuous, bent line. By setting this flag developers can specify an enlarged point (an anchor) be plotted at the junctions of adjacent line segments.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.RadarChartAppearance.SplineTension
member.summary: Retrieves or adjusts the spline tension.

remarks.p: The spline tension controls how tightly the curve bends to fit the data points. The spline value should be greater than 0.0 but less than 0.5, with higher values leading to more sweeping, smoothened curves.

member.name: T:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.ScrollScaleAppearance
member.summary: Appearance object governing how Scrolling and Scaling behave for the end user, and whether scrollbars should be enabled.

remarks.p: This is a child appearance appearing on the corresponding to each axis. This object covers the presentation of a scrollbar (with zoom-in/zoom-out buttons for scaling) on one specific axis.

Scrolling and scaling can only be performed on two-dimensional axes. On hybrid charts (or custom layers where secondary axes are bound to separate data), X/X2 and Y/Y2 scrolling and scaling can be done independently of each other.
For backwards compatibility, scrollbars are not displayed by default.

member.summary: Determines whether or not this object should be serialized.

member.summary: Resets this object to its default state.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.ScrollScaleAppearance.Width
member.summary: Width of the scrollbar (in pixels).

remarks.p: It is sometimes more convenient to think of the width of the scrollbar as its thickness. The scrollbar will always run the length spanned by the axis.
Width applies to the 2-D thickness of the flat scrollbar rendered; when appearing in 3-D charts a scrollbar should have both a Width and a specified.
This property is not used by WebChart. To enable the scrollbar in WebChart, set UltraChart.EnableScrollbar to True.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.ScrollScaleAppearance.Height
member.summary: Height of the scrollbar (in pixels).

remarks.p: This property will only apply to 3-D charts, and has been reserved for future use. It presently has no effect.
This property is not used by WebChart. To enable the scrollbar in WebChart, set UltraChart.EnableScrollbar to True.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.ScrollScaleAppearance.Visible
member.summary: Flag indicating whether the scrollbar is visible or hidden on the present Axis.

remarks.p: For backwards compatibility, the scrollbars default to hidden.
This property is not used by WebChart. To enable the scrollbar in WebChart, set UltraChart.EnableScrollbar to True.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.ScrollScaleAppearance.Scroll
member.summary: The scroll position.

remarks.p: This property defines how the scrollbar is positioned when the chart is originally displayed to the end user. It may have values of between 0.0 and 1.0.

By default, there is no scroll position because the entire chart is in view. Scrolling is only effective when the end user has zoomed-in ( is less than 1.0), whereupon the end user has someplace to scroll to.
This property is not used by WebChart. To enable the scrollbar in WebChart, set UltraChart.EnableScrollbar to True.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.ScrollScaleAppearance.Scale
member.summary: The scale of magnification.

remarks.p: This property defines how the present view is scaled when presented to the end user. It may have values of between 1.0 and 0.0. A value of 0.5 indicates that the end user can see 1/2 of the chart on the dimension of the current axis, and that any chart elements visible are scaled by a zoom-in factor of 2X.
By default, the end user view of the chart is fully scaled out such that the entire chart is visible.
This property is not used by WebChart. To enable the scrollbar in WebChart, set UltraChart.EnableScrollbar to True.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.SkinAppearance.ApplyRowWise
member.summary: Apply this motif on a per-series basis.

remarks.p: Skinning chart elements row-wise applies one member of the array to each row of data; this typically corresponds to a series in many chart types. In order to apply a consistent skinning by fields of data charted (based on underlying data columns), set this property to False.
For best results, it is recommended there be at least as many (or more) PaintElement objects in the PaintElement array as there are rows (when applied row-wise) or columns (when not row-wise).
The default value for row-wise motif application is True.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.SkinAppearance.PEs
member.summary: Collection of PaintElements to apply as a motif to the current chart.

remarks.p: Developers should assign an array of PaintElement instances to this property to specify the fill colors, shadings, textures, and/or outlines of chart elements to meet their application-defined color scheme requirements.
It is not recommended to use to affect custom highlighting effects, but rather to adjust the PE of the chart element's Primitive directly through the IProvidePrimitives interface.
Whenever changing the values of PaintElements within this array dynamically within your application, the developer must call Invalidate on the control for the new motif to take effect.
This property can only be assigned and customized at run-time.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.SkinAppearance.PaintElement
member.summary: Gets/Sets the array of PaintElements used by this Skin.
member.remarks: When available, please use SkinAppearance.PEs instead of this property.

member.name: T:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.SplineAppearance
member.summary: An Appearance object representing the style properties for a Spline.

remarks.p: A spline is a curvilinear path that approximates data points (that may ordinarily be connected by line segments) using Bzier calculations that smoothen out "noisy" data points. For more information on controlling the smoothing factor employed by a spline, see the property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.SplineAppearance.Thickness
member.summary: Retrieves or adjusts the thickness of the plotted splines.

remarks.p: Determines the thickness of the splines drawn in this SplineChart. The thickness, or spline width, is measured in pixels, and it can have values between 0 to 10. Setting a spline thickness of 0 allows developers to essentially set splines to an non-visible state.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.SplineAppearance.DrawStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the LineDrawStyle for drawing each spline within this chart.

remarks.p: Determines how the spline will be rendered (e.g. Solid, Dash, Dotted, etc.) Please consult the documentation for the LineDrawStyle enumeration for details.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.SplineAppearance.SplineTension
member.summary: Retrieves or adjusts the spline tension.

remarks.p: The spline tension controls how tightly the curve bends to fit the data points. The spline value should be greater than 0.0 but less than 0.5, with higher values leading to more sweeping, smoothened curves.

member.name: T:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.SplineAreaChartAppearance

remarks.p: This class contains the properties that describe styles specific to Spline-Area hybrid charts (that is a chart where one Y-Axis serves as the axis for Spline chart data, while the other Y-Axis serves Area Chart data.) Each vertical axis may scale differently, and each chart may bind to separate data.

remarks.p: The spline tension controls how tightly the curve bends to fit the data points. The spline value should be greater than 0.0 but less than 0.5, with higher values leading to more sweeping, smoothened curves.

member.name: T:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.SplineChartAppearance
member.summary: An Appearance object containing the style properties for Spline Charts.

remarks.p: UltraChart relies on Appearance objects to encapsulate its style and presentation information. This class contains the properties that describe styles specific to Spline Chart.
A spline chart is a two-dimensional graph similar to a LineChart, but uses Bzier curves to smoothen out data points (see the property for details.)

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.SplineChartAppearance.#ctor
member.summary: Creates Spline Chart Appearance object with default properties.

member.summary: Creates Spline Chart Appearance object with default properties for given charting component.
member.param: The component to serve as an Appearance.

member.summary: Indicates whether the SplineTension property has changed from its default value.
member.returns: Returns True if the SplineTension property is not set to its default value; otherwise, it returns False.

remarks.p: Invoke the method to reset this property to its default value.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.SplineChartAppearance.ResetSplineTension
member.summary: Resets the SplineTension property to its default value.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.SplineChartAppearance.ShouldSerialize
member.summary: Check if any property has a non-default value.
member.returns: True if any property has a non-default value, False otherwise.

remarks.p: When one or more properties change in value, it is necessary to serialize their new values. This state management is handled by the designer.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.SplineChartAppearance.SplineTension
member.summary: Retrieves or adjusts the spline tension.

remarks.p: The spline tension controls how tightly the curve bends to fit the data points. The spline value should be greater than 0.0 but less than 0.5, with higher values leading to more sweeping, smoothened curves.

member.name: T:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.StackAppearance
member.summary: An Appearance object containing style information for presenting stacked chart types, in 2-D and 3-D.

remarks.p: This appearance object applies to charts of the following ChartTypes:

Stacked charts add an implicit additional dimension to data in their rendition of 'piles', where each field of data is charted proportionately to others within its series. In addition to the properties of this class, some properties of or may also be applicable to stacked charts of the appropriate type.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.StackAppearance.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a default StackAppearance object.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.StackAppearance.#ctor(Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.IChartComponent)
member.summary: Creates a StackAppearance object with the given charting component.
member.param: An IChartComponent reference to a charting component.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.StackAppearance.ShouldSerializeStackStyle
member.summary: Indicates whether the StackStyle property has changed from its default value.
member.returns: True if the StackStyle property has changed from its default value and needs to be serialized; False otherwise.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.StackAppearance.ResetStackStyle
member.summary: Resets the StackStyle property to its default value.

remarks.p: The default value of the property is Normal.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.StackAppearance.ShouldSerialize
member.summary: Indicates if this object has changed and needs to be persisted.
member.returns: True if this object changed from its default value; otherwise it returns False.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.StackAppearance.StackStyle
member.summary: Specifies how separate stack piles compare to each other.

remarks.p: Piles may be compared to one another with either of the Normal stack style (the default), or the Complete stack style. In the Normal style, the length of each pile corresponds to the sum of its fields, and absolute comparisons of fields between piles can be made. When the Complete style is applied, each pile, regardless of the sum of its fields, has a constant length and judgements as to the proportionality of fields can more easily be made.
In 3-D charts, use of the Complete style is not recommended.

member.name: T:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.StripLineAppearance
member.summary: An Appearance containing the style and presentation information for displaying strip lines on an Axis.

remarks.p: Striplines are narrow rectangular bands or "stripes" that appear at a periodic interval behind graphic chart elements. Strip lines can be used on any 2-D axis where grouping occurs, such as the X-axis of a column chart or the Y-axis of a bar or Gantt chart.

Developers can activate striplines on a single axis by retrieving the appropriate object and setting the StripLines property to True. The effect of turning on striplines for multiple axes is undefined.
Strip lines will be orthogonal to their parent axis, and appear behind every Nth data element as specified by the property.

member.summary: Check if any property has a not default value.

remarks.p: Some objects do not have values that can be converted to a string. In these cases, an empty string is returned.

member.summary: Creates and returns a copy of this StripLineAppearance.
member.returns: A copy of this StripLineAppearance.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.StripLineAppearance.Visible
member.summary: Indicates whether Strip lines are displayed.

remarks.p: When set to true, the chart will display strip lines in its background.
The value of this property is ignored if the active chart type is not supported (Strip lines apply only to 2D Charts).

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.StripLineAppearance.Interval
member.summary: The number of days (or series) skipped between strip lines.

remarks.p: This property allows customization of the frequency of strip lines appearing behind the chart. Please note that the count of items that determine whether a strip line should be drawn or not depends on the axis style (continuous, group by series, or chronological). The value for Interval must be a positive integer (greater than zero).

member.summary: Retrieves the PaintElement used when rendering each strip line.
member.returns: A reference to a PaintElement (alternately known as a fill brush).

remarks.p: Developers control the color, gradient or hatch of the strip lines rendered using the properties of the PaintElement class.

member.name: T:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.View3DAppearance
member.summary: An Appearance object controlling the user's perspective on 3-D charts.

remarks.p: Developers can set properties on this Appearance object at design-time or run-time to alter the vantage point a user has when examining a three-dimensional chart, including specifying the , and/or around each of the three axes.

Three-dimensional charts are displayed in a 3-D chart grid area, with XY, XZ and YZ backplanes and a clear frontal view. Using this class, developers may rotate a chart such that the user is looking at it through a backplane (ie, from behind or underneath the chart grid). The result of such viewing angles are undefined. Instead of rotating behind the chart grid, developers should re-orient the data plotted in the 3-D chart to bring background elements to the front for the user to examine.

End users may rotate and revolve charts (in UltraWinChart only) at run-time by holding down the ALT-key on the keyboard and dragging the mouse. Developers can disable this by intercepting and terminating mouse events when the ALT-key is depressed.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.View3DAppearance.XRotation
member.summary: Specifies the degree of rotation along the X-axis of a 3-D chart.

remarks.p: The value specified is in terms of degrees. 0 represents no rotation, with each additional 90 degrees rotating the chart one quarter around the X-Axis. The X-Axis is the horizontal axis, it forms the XY ground plane with the Y-Axis.
The and properties specify the degree of rotation along the Y- and Z-Axis, respectively.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.View3DAppearance.YRotation
member.summary: Specifies the degree of rotation along the Y-axis of a 3-D chart.

remarks.p: The value specified is in terms of degrees. 0 represents no rotation, with each additional 90 degrees rotating the chart one quarter around the Y-Axis. The Y-Axis is the axis leading into the screen, because the ground plane of all 3-D charts is the XY plane.
The and properties specify the degree of rotation along the X- and Z-Axis, respectively.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.View3DAppearance.ZRotation
member.summary: Specifies the degree of rotation along the Z-axis of a 3-D chart.

remarks.p: The value specified is in terms of degrees. 0 represents no rotation, with each additional 90 degrees rotating the chart one quarter around the Z-Axis. The Z-Axis is the vertical axis.
The and properties specify the degree of rotation along the X- and Y-axis, respectively.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.View3DAppearance.Scale
member.summary: Specifies the scale of a 3-D chart, as a percentage of full scale.

remarks.p: A value of 100 represents 100%, meaning the chart is rendered at full scale. A setting of 50 would render the chart at half the size of full scale, while 200 would do so at twice the size of full scale. Scaling out to maximum (1/20th scale) may make the chart and its labels unreadable.

End users (in UltraWinChart only) can zoom-in or zoom-out of the chart at run-time by depressing the ALT key while rotating the mouse wheel. Developers can disable this functionality by intercepting and terminating the mouse wheel event themselves.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.View3DAppearance.Perspective
member.summary: Specifies the perspective of a 3-D chart, as a percentage of full perspective.

remarks.p: A value of 100 represents 100%, meaning the chart is rendered at full perspective.

Perspective is the way in which objects appear to the eye based on their dimensions and the position. For example, the parallel lines of a railway track are perceived as meeting at a distant point at the horizon. As objects become more distant, they begin to appear smaller.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.View3DAppearance.Light
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the Light effect is in an enabled state.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.View3DAppearance.Outline
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the outlines of the 3D objects are drawn.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.View3DAppearance.EdgeSize
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the size of the 3D objects edge

remarks.p: The edge size is size of the 3d beveled edges of some 3D objects. It is floating point value and it represents a size in pixels.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.WebTooltipAppearance.Display
member.summary: Returns or sets a value that determines when tooltips are displayed.

remarks.p: Tooltips can be displayed when the cursor moves over, or the user clicks, a data point, or not at all.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.WebTooltipAppearance.Format
member.summary: Returns or sets a value that specifies the pre-defined format to use for tooltip text.

remarks.p: Use this property to select a pre-defined format for tooltip text. A custom format can be specified by setting the property. If the FormatString property is set, this property will be set to Custom.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.WebTooltipAppearance.FormatString
member.summary: Returns or sets a string of text that specifies the custom format of tooltip text.

remarks.p: This property specifies a custom format for tooltip text. The property can be used to select a pre-defined format. If this property is set, the Format property will be set to Custom.
Please see the "String Formats" topic of the UltraChart help for the appropriate values of this property.

member.summary: Returns or sets a Boolean value that determines whether tooltips should fade in when they are displayed.

remarks.p: True if tooltips should fade in when they are displayed; otherwise, False.
Tooltips are only displayed when the property is set to a value other than Never.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.WinTooltipAppearance.SetHighlightDataPoint(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Turn on the highlighting of a chart element by its underlying row and column.
member.param: The data row of the chart element.
The data column of the chart element.

remarks.p: This turns on highlighting of chart elements by rendering a slightly smaller version of an identical chart element on top of the existing chart element. If the underlying chart element has texturing or shading that should show through, then consider setting the to a partially transparent color (one with an alpha component of less than 255).

Highlighting added by this method can be removed by just calling . If the supplied row and column is not valid (or it does not correspond to a chart element being displayed) then no chart element will be highlighted.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.WinTooltipAppearance.SetHighlightClearAll
member.summary: Turn off the highlighting of all chart elements that were turned on.

remarks.p: This method clears all highlighting of chart elements that were turned on by . It may not affect highlighting applied by custom layers.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.WinTooltipAppearance.GetChartInfoFromPoint(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reports information about the row and column underlying a chart element at a control-relative on-screen position.
member.param: A horizontal X pixel coordinate (0 is at the left edge of the control).
A vertical Y pixel coordinate (0 is at the top edge of the control).

remarks.p: The location is relative to the top left corner (0,0) of the UltraWinChart control. The returned ChartDataEventArgs object contains the same event arguments as would be returned from handling the ChartDataClicked event.

member.returns: Information about a data point on the chart by pixel location X and Y as a ChartDataEventArgs object.

member.summary: Resets the property to its default value.

remarks.p: Invoke this method to reset the PE property to its default value.
Once this method is invoked, the method will return False until the PE property is set again.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.WinTooltipAppearance.Display
member.summary: Returns or sets a value that determines when tooltips are displayed.

remarks.p: Tooltips can be displayed on a developer-specified trigger, or not at all.

When this property is assigned the value MouseClick, a tooltip is displayed when the user clicks on a chart element. When the value MouseMove is assigned to this property, any mouse movement above a chart element causes the tooltip to appear.
Tooltips can be hidden by assigning the value Never to this property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.WinTooltipAppearance.HighlightDataPoint
member.summary: Flag indicating whether chart elements are highlightable.

remarks.p: When chart elements are highlightable depends on the value of the property. If the Display property is set to Never, chart elements will not be highlighted.
The and properties specify the fill and outline colors of the highlighting, respectively.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.WinTooltipAppearance.Format
member.summary: Style affecting the pre-defined format string used for rendering tooltip text.

remarks.p: Use this property to select a pre-defined format for tooltip text. A custom format can be specified by setting the property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.WinTooltipAppearance.FormatString
member.summary: The formatting string that specifies the custom format of tooltip text.

remarks.p: This property specifies a custom format for tooltip text. The property can be used to select a pre-defined format. If this property is set, the Format property will be set to Custom.
Please see the "String Formats" topic of the UltraChart help for typical formatting keywords used by this property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.WinTooltipAppearance.Font
member.summary: Returns a reference to or sets a Font object that specifies the font used for tooltips.

remarks.p: The property specifies the font used for tooltip text.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.WinTooltipAppearance.FontColor
member.summary: Returns a reference to or sets a Color object that specifies the color of tooltips.

remarks.p: The property specifies the color of the font used for tooltips.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.WinTooltipAppearance.AlphaLevel
member.summary: Returns or sets a value that specifies the level of alpha blending used to display a tooltip.

remarks.p: The valid range of values for this property are from 0 to 255, inclusive. A value of 0 indicates the tooltip is completely transparent; 255, completely opaque. Changing the property value also updates the AlphaLevel.
Developers should use the property instead of the individual color properties, as the class offers superior shading and texturing capabilities.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.WinTooltipAppearance.BorderStyle
member.summary: Returns or sets a value that specifies the drawing style of tooltip borders.

remarks.p: This property indicates the style of tooltip borders.
The and properties specify the color and thickness of tooltip borders, respectively.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.WinTooltipAppearance.BorderThickness
member.summary: Returns or sets a value that determines the thickness of tooltip borders.

remarks.p: The value specified is in pixels.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.WinTooltipAppearance.BorderColor
member.summary: Returns a reference to or sets a Color object that specifies the border color of tooltips.

remarks.p: The property specifies the border color used in the rectangular outline of the tooltips.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.WinTooltipAppearance.BackColor
member.summary: Returns a reference to or sets a Color object that specifies the background color of tooltips.

remarks.p: The property specifies the background color of tooltips.
This property also affects the property by resetting the AlphaLevel to the transparency of this background color, if any.
Developers should use the property instead of the individual color properties, as the class offers superior shading and texturing capabilities.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.WinTooltipAppearance.HighlightFillColor
member.summary: Returns a reference to or sets a Color object that specifies the background color of data point highlight.

remarks.p: Data point highlights are only displayed when the property is set to True. If the HighlightDataPoint property is set to False, this property is ignored.
The property specifies the color of the highlight outline.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.WinTooltipAppearance.HighlightOutlineColor
member.summary: Returns a reference to or sets a Color object that specifies the color of data point highlight outline.

remarks.p: Data point highlights are only displayed when the property is set to True. If the HighlightDataPoint property is set to False, this property is ignored.
The property specifies the background color of the highlight.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.WinTooltipAppearance.PE
member.summary: Retrieves the PaintElement used when rendering the background and border of the tooltip.
member.returns: A reference to a PaintElement (alternately known as a fill brush).

remarks.p: Developers control the color, gradient or hatch of the tooltip box rendered behind tooltip text using the properties of the PaintElement class.

member.summary: Control displayed within the tooltip.

member.summary: Indicates whether a is used.

member.summary: Gets/sets the way tooltip overflow will be controlled.

member.name: T:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.DrillDownID
member.summary: DrillDownID identifies the relational data row and column drillable from a parent chart in the drill down hierarchy.

remarks.p: DrillDownID is used by DrillElement and offers properties for identifying the data row and the data column underlying a rendered chart element in a parent chart. This is used to locate a matching DrillElement in the drill down implementation. It should not be necessary for developers to work directly with DrillDownID objects.

member.summary: Default constructor for DrillDownID creates an Empty identification.

member.summary: Parameterized constructor for DrillDownID accepting a row and column.
member.param: The data row of the graphical entity on the chart.
The data column of the graphical entity on the chart.

remarks.p: This is the preferred means of creating a DrillDownID object.

member.summary: Acts as a hash function for DrillDownID, and is suitable for use with hash tables and other data structures.
member.returns: A hash value for this DrillDownID object.

member.param: Another object to compare this one with.
member.returns: True if both objects have equivalent values, false otherwise.

member.name: T:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.DrillElement
member.summary: DrillElement represents a drillable chart in the drill down hierarchy. It is used by the DrillElement array of a chart's DrillDownAppearance.

remarks.p: Developers set the properties of DrillElement for the top most chart and each child chart that can be drilled to. The end result of successfully preparing a set of DrillElements will be a tree-like structure where the data elements rendered on the chart are drillable to different child charts depicting more detailed information (potentially presented in alternate chart types, i.e., drilling from a 3D Bar Chart to a Pie Chart).

For these purposes, developers will find it necessary to set (at minimum) the DrillElement's ID property (identifying what data element on a parent chart will be drillable), its Data source (identifying where information comes from to populate the child chart drilled to), and the chart type (of the child chart).

An additional property that may be of interest include setting an IDrillDown implementation that will be called-back when a drill down occurs to that child chart. Setting an IDrillDown implementation is optional, but provides an opportunity for the application to customize the presentation of the Chart's title, axes, et al.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.DrillElement.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor for DrillElement objects.

remarks.p: Developers are encouraged to use one of the parameterized constructors for this class. Initializing DrillElement objects through this constructor still leaves the developer with the responsibility of setting the DrillElement's properties.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.DrillElement.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.ChartType,System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor for DrillElement accepting arguments that initialize all mandatory properties.
member.param: The row in the parent chart's data underlying the drillable chart element.
The column in the parent chart's data underlying the drillable chart element.
The chart type presented in the child chart.
The data source to be bound to the child chart.

remarks.p: This constructor provides developers with a convenient means of initializing all mandatory properties of a DrillElement object. By default, DrillElement objects created by this constructor do not specify an implementation to receive callback notifications.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.DrillElement.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.ChartType,System.Object,Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.IDrillDown)
member.summary: Constructor for DrillElement accepting arguments that initialize all commonly-used properties.
member.param: The row in the parent chart's data underlying the drillable chart element.
The column in the parent chart's data underlying the drillable chart element.
The chart type presented in the child chart.
The data source to be bound to the child chart.
A reference to an object implementing IDrillDown that will be notified when the chart element corresponding to this DrillElement has been drilled.

remarks.p: This constructor provides developers with a convenient means of initializing all commonly-used properties of a DrillElement object, including the optional callback.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.DrillElement.ID
member.summary: Identifies the underlying data of a drillable chart element.

remarks.p: The ID property is a DrillDownID object that identifies the data row and column underlying a given chart element that will be drillable. During drill down processing, a DrillElements is located based on its matching a DrillDownID in the currently displayed parent chart. Failing to properly initialize a DrillElement's ID is the most likely cause of a chart element not behaving as if it were drillable at run-time.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.DrillElement.ChartType
member.summary: ChartType of the child chart upon drilling of this DrillElement.

remarks.p:
During drill down processing, the chart control changes its ChartType to the child ChartType specified by this property. This ChartType may be different from the ChartType in which the user "drilled down." It is the developer's responsibility to make any changes to the chart to accomodate a change in ChartType. These changes most commonly involve:
changing the title(s) displayed by the TitleAppearance.
altering the scale(s) of the AxisAppearance.
updating the layout, orientation and format strings of any AxisLabelAppearances.
Certain child chart types may require additional accomodations (for example, PieLabelAppearance in PieChart and PieChart3D).

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.DrillElement.DataSource
member.summary: DataSource bound to the child chart upon drilling of this DrillElement.

remarks.p: During drill down processing, the chart control is re-bound to the DataSource of this DrillElement. It is the responsibility of the developer that the DataSource be compatible with the child .

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.DrillElement.DrillDown
member.summary: This property holds an IDrillDown implementation that is called back when "drill down" occurs on this DrillElement.

remarks.p: Specifying an IDrillDown implementation for a DrillElemnt is optional, and if left unspecified no callback into application code occurs.

Developers are encouraged to supply an IDrillDown implementation on DrillElement to handle cases when drilling down changes chart type and/or appearance in the child chart. The callback method on this interface is invoked after the chart has changed type (to ), and after data (from ) has been bound to the child chart.

member.summary: Base class for Effects.

member.name: T:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.IEffect
member.summary: Interface for all Effect classes.

remarks.p: While this interface has two overloads of the Apply method; it may be appropriate only to implement one of them, depending on the Effect's behavior.
If this is the case, simply return without taking any action in the method overload that is not being used.
All Effects added to the Chart's Effects collection will have both of these methods called once during the chart's rendering process.

member.name: T:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.IChartComponent
member.summary: Interface representing the common, low-level component features in UltraWinChart and UltraWebChart.

remarks.p: When programming the chart control's advanced features (e.g., ILayer implementation), the chart exposes some of the necessary functionality (such as ChartAppearances) only through IChartComponent. Familiarity with this interface empowers developers to make greater use of the Chart control's layer building framework.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.IChartComponent.ResizeAll
member.summary: Resizes all drawing layers and their bounding box.

remarks.p: This method resizes all drawing layers (a chart can be thought of as being composed of a number of transparent layers, each overlaying the other and contributing additional information to the presentation). It also updates the bounding boxes based on whether the layers have, in aggregate, grown or diminished.
Resize and refresh operations are initiated by the control automatically when a size-related property changes its value.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.IChartComponent.Invalidate(Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.CacheLevel)
member.summary: Redraws the image with adornments.
member.param: Cache level to invalidate.

remarks.p: This method re-renders the chart image with all of its adornments (these are tooltips, highlights, etc) when an Appearance changes. It will additionally set a dirty flag dependent upon the flag passed as an argument to the invalidation. The greater the cache level, the more primitives will require redrawing.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.IChartComponent.GetChartInfoFromPoint(System.Drawing.Point)
member.summary: Gets related to a mouse click event.

remarks.p: This method populates an informative object, , related to the processing of mouse click events on the chart. It maps the point coordinates in the chart grid area to a chart element, and then further translates that chart element into an underlying piece of data (identified by column and row).

member.param: Point at which mouse was clicked.
member.returns: Information about the underlying data row and column, and particulars of the mouse click event.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.IChartComponent.GetChartAppearance(Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.Appearance.ChartAppearanceTypes)
member.summary: Gets an Appearance from the Chart component.
member.param: Requested chart appearance type.

remarks.p: This method can be used to retrieve references of many of the Appearance-derived objects on a Chart component instance (for instance, axis or label appearances). It is exposed to support the development of custom implementations.
Developers are encouraged to use the public Appearance properties of the Chart whenever possible.

member.returns: The ChartAppearance subclass corresponding to the requested ChartAppearanceType, or null if the ChartAppearance is unavailable.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.IChartComponent.OnAppearanceChanged
member.summary: Handles when an Appearance of the charting component has changed one or more values.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.IChartComponent.IsDesignMode
member.summary: Is the component in design mode?
member.returns: True when the IChartComponent is in Design-mode, false otherwise.

remarks.p: Design-mode refers to the design-time property browsing, prototyping, and manipulations of integrated development environments (IDEs). When the component is living in this environment it may behave differently than it would in run-time (as far as looking for live, dynamic data sources, for instance). This indicator facilitates identification of design-time from run-time environments.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.IChartComponent.ResetDemoData
member.summary: Resets demonstration data.

remarks.p: The component includes some sample data compatible with its many chart types. It is this data that is rendered in the design-time environment to render prototypical charts that aid the developer in visualizing the final chart's appearance. Calling this method resets this sample data.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.IChartComponent.GetProperty(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the value of arbitrary properties.
member.param: The property name; if the property is nested, the property name may include '.' characters to qualify the property's scope.
member.returns: The value of the requested property. If the property value is a ValueType, it is boxed. If the property could not be found, null is returned.

remarks.p: Retrieves an untyped property value by name from the chart component through reflection.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.IChartComponent.SetProperty(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Sets the value of an arbitrary property.
member.param: The property name; if the property is nested, the property name may include '.' characters to qualify the property's scope.
The new value for the property.
member.returns: The former value of the requested property. If the property value is a ValueType, it is boxed. If the property could not be found, null is returned.

remarks.p: Updates an untyped property value by name from the chart component through reflection. Changing appearance properties will also refresh the control by repainting/invalidating it.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.IChartComponent.DataValidity(System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Sets whether data is valid or not.
member.param: Is it valid?
An informational text message.

remarks.p: This method sets whether data is valid or not. It is called usuallly only for invalid data, so that an event can be fired from the IChartComponent.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.IChartComponent.DataValidity(System.Boolean,Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Events.ChartDataInvalidEventArgs)
member.summary: Sets whether data is valid or not.
member.param: Is it valid?
ChartDataInvalidArgs for raising the InvalidDataReceived event, if the Data is invalid.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.IChartComponent.GetComponentInfo
member.summary: Gets component information necessary for displaying the correct property-set in the Designer environment.

remarks.p: This method supports the charting infrastructure, and is not intended to be called from application code.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.IChartComponent.Subscribe(System.String,System.EventHandler)
member.summary: Subscribes to an unpublished event of the charting component.
member.param: An identifier for the requested event.
An event handler of the correct signature for handling the requested event.

remarks.p: This method supports the charting infrastructure, and is not intended to be called from application code.
Developers should always add and remove handlers from UltraChart using the published events on the control.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.IChartComponent.UserLayerIndex
member.summary: Identifies Layers by ID string, and arranges them in Z-Order.

remarks.p: This property manages an array of strings where each string uniquely identifies a layer (these string identifies should correspond to the LayerID property of ILayer). During the processing of layers, the FillSceneGraph is called on each layer in the order it's Layer ID appears in the UserLayerIndex. Layers listed towards the end of this string array are therefore rendered last, and effectively appear in the foreground.

member.name: T:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.IDrillDown
member.summary: Implementing the IDrillDown interface is optional, but recommended, when the application would like notification of drill down events.

remarks.p: Developers set a reference to an IDrillDown implementation on any or all DrillElement objects added to the property of DrillDownAppearance. This reference gets called after the user clicks on a chart element in the parent chart to drill down, and immediately before the child chart (corresponding to that DrillElement) becomes the renders on the control. Some behavior that might be necessary in the IDrillDown callback implementation a developer is expected to provide to respond to these notifications includes changing the appearance of axis labels (for a different child chart type than that of the parent), changing the chart's title, and/or altering other application-dependent logic based on the currently displayed chart.

While the same IDrillDown implementation can be provided to handle all chart drill downs, it is recommended that one IDrillDown implementation be created for each child chart. This permits any data element rendered in the chart to be distinguishable by the IDrillDown implementation (in the supplied row and column arguments to the Drill() method).

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.IDrillDown.Drill(System.Int32,System.Int32,Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.ChartType,System.Object)
member.summary: Method called by UltraChart infrastructure when the user drills down into a chart element.
member.param: DataRow index underlying the parent chart element the end user has drilled down into.
DataColumn index underlying the parent chart element the end user has drilled down into.
The future chart type (after the Drill callback returns.)
The future data source (bound to the future chart type after Drill callback returns.)

remarks.p: This is a callback method from within the control's drill down processing that gives developers the opportunity to modify a chart's appearance and presentation when end users drill down into previously prepared drillable chart elements (see the class for more information on defining the drill down hierarchy).

member.name: T:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.IDrillDown2
member.summary: Implementing the IDrillDown2 interface is optional, but recommended, when the application would like notification of drill down events.

remarks.p: Developers set a reference to an IDrillDown implementation on any or all DrillElement objects added to the property of DrillDownAppearance. This reference gets called after the user clicks on a chart element in the parent chart to drill down, and immediately before the child chart (corresponding to that DrillElement) becomes the renders on the control. Some behavior that might be necessary in the IDrillDown callback implementation a developer is expected to provide to respond to these notifications includes changing the appearance of axis labels (for a different child chart type than that of the parent), changing the chart's title, and/or altering other application-dependent logic based on the currently displayed chart.

While the same IDrillDown implementation can be provided to handle all chart drill downs, it is recommended that one IDrillDown implementation be created for each child chart. This permits any data element rendered in the chart to be distinguishable by the IDrillDown implementation (in the supplied row and column arguments to the Drill() method).

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.IDrillDown2.PostDrill(System.Int32,System.Int32,Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.ChartType,System.Object)
member.summary: Method called by UltraChart infrastructure when the user drills down into a chart element. This method is called after the first Drill has happened.
member.param: DataRow index underlying the parent chart element the end user has drilled down into.
DataColumn index underlying the parent chart element the end user has drilled down into.
The future chart type (after the Drill callback returns.)
The future data source (bound to the future chart type after Drill callback returns.)

remarks.p: This is a callback method from within the control's drill down processing that gives developers the opportunity to modify a chart's appearance and presentation when end users drill down into previously prepared drillable chart elements (see the class for more information on defining the drill down hierarchy).

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Resources.IDrillDown2.Cancel
member.summary: Please set this flag in DrillMethod to cancel post drilling.

member.name: T:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.ColorModels
member.summary: The set of Color models to use when rendering a chart

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.ColorModels.LinearRange
member.summary: Colors are chosen from ColorStart to ColorEnd in order, with repeat

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.ColorModels.LinearRandom
member.summary: Random colors are chosen from ColorStart to ColorEnd

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.ColorModels.PureRandom
member.summary: Colors are chosen on a random basis

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.ColorModels.Wireframe
member.summary: Draw the outline of chart objects only with no fill color

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.ColorModels.CustomLinear
member.summary: Use the CustomPalette property to retrieve colors in order, with repeat

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.ColorModels.CustomRandom
member.summary: Use the CustomPalette property to retrieve colors on a random basis

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.ColorModels.CustomSkin
member.summary: Use the PaintElement property to retrieve colors and Paint Elements.

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.ColorModels.DataValueCustomLinear
member.summary: Use the CustomPalette property to retrieve colors for each primitive (shape) in the chart, based on the underlying data values.

remarks.p: The lowest data values will be assigned the color at the beginning of the palette, whereas the highest data values will be assigned the color at the end of the palette.

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.ColorModels.DataValueLinearRange
member.summary: Use the ColorBegin and ColorEnd properties to specify two ends of a color spectrum. Each primitive (shape) in the chart will be assigned a color between ColorBegin and ColorEnd, based on the underlying data values.

remarks.p: When a DataValueLinearRange Color Model is used, the lowest values in the data will be colored at the low end of the color range, ColorBegin. The highest values in the data will be colored at the high end of the color range, ColorEnd. Values in between will be colored in a blend of these two colors. If the legend is visible, it will appear as a special type of legend which uses a gradient to illustrate what color will be used for numeric values within the range.

member.name: T:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.ColorScaling
member.summary: If a ColorScaling scheme is chosen then the color model will scale the set of colors that repeat for each series by increasing or decreasing the brightness/contrast appropriately

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.ColorScaling.None
member.summary: Do not scale the colors

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.ColorScaling.Increasing
member.summary: Increase the brightness/contrast between sets

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.ColorScaling.Decreasing
member.summary: Decrease the brightness/contrast between sets

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.ColorScaling.Oscillating
member.summary: Oscillate the brightness/contrast up and down between sets

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.ColorScaling.Random
member.summary: Randomly raise or lower the brightness/constrast between sets

remarks.p: The property specifies the font used for label text.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.LabelStyle.WrapText
member.summary: Returns or sets a Boolean value that determines whether label text is wrapped onto multiple lines if necessary, if this label type supports wrapping.

remarks.p: True to indicate that label text that does not fit will be wrapped onto multiple lines; otherwise, False.
The property determines whether label text will be clipped.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.LabelStyle.HorizontalAlign
member.summary: Returns or sets a value that specifies the horizontal alignment of label text.

remarks.p: The property specifies vertical alignment of label text.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.LabelStyle.VerticalAlign
member.summary: Returns or sets a value that specifies the vertical alignment of label text.

remarks.p: The property specifies horizontal alignment of label text.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.LabelStyle.ClipText
member.summary: Returns or sets a Boolean value that determines whether label text will be clipped if there is not enough space for it, if this label type supports clipping.

remarks.p: True to indicate that label text that does not fit is clipped; otherwise, False.
The property determines whether label text will be wrapped.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.LabelStyle.Trimming
member.summary: Type of StringTrimming to use if this label is clipped.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.LabelStyle.ReverseText
member.summary: Determines whether or not the labels text should be reversed.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.LabelStyle.Orientation
member.summary: Returns or sets a value that specifies the orientation of label text, if this label type supports orientation.

remarks.p: This property controls the direction of label text.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.LabelStyle.RotationAngle
member.summary: Returns or sets a value that specifies the degree of rotation of label text, if this label type supports orientation and the Orientation property is set to Custom.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.LabelStyle.FontSizeBestFit
member.summary: Determines whether or not to use the largest font possible within the text boundaries, if this label type uses boundaries.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.LabelStyle.Flip
member.summary: Determines whether or not this label will be turned upside-down at its specified orientation, if this label type supports orientation.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.LabelStyle.Dx
member.summary: Horizontal offset distance of label text relative to its rectangle's top-left.

remarks.p: This property is frequently set on labels by the chart core. When changing its value, be aware that it may already be storing a value for the chart core, and it might get changed again by the chart core. This is particularly true in the case of axis labels.
The best practice for changing this property's value in code is to increment or decrement its existing value, rather than changing it to a new value altogether.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.LabelStyle.Dy
member.summary: Vertical offset distance of label text relative to its rectangle's top-left.

remarks.p: This property is frequently set on labels by the chart core. When changing its value, be aware that it may already be storing a value for the chart core, and it might get changed again by the chart core. This is particularly true in the case of axis labels.
The best practice for changing this property's value in code is to increment or decrement its existing value, rather than changing it to a new value altogether.

member.name: T:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.GradientStyle
member.summary: Specifies how a color gradient will be used to fill the background of any graphical object.

remarks.p: A gradient is a blend of color beginning at the principle color for this graphical object, specified by the Fill property, and then smoothly interpolating into the color specified by the FillStopColor property. The interpolation for most gradient styles is done over a Bell curve.

Bump and two-color gradients transition their color from the principle color (defined as the Fill color) at the center into the FillStopColor at the edge(s). Examples of gradients that use this approach include HorizontalBump, VerticalBump, Circular, Elliptical and Rectangular.

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.GradientStyle.Default
member.summary: No gradient (solid background color fill) by default.

remarks.p: Where possible, developers should use None in lieu of Default. The definition of a Default gradient may change in the future.

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.GradientStyle.None
member.summary: No gradient (solid background color fill).

remarks.p: Using None is preferred to using Default.

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.GradientStyle.Vertical
member.summary: Specifies a gradient from top to bottom.

remarks.p: The mathematical definition of a vertical gradient is a linear change as one moves in a vertical direction. This is the definition exposed by the underlying framework, however developers should be conscious of the fact it may differ from the artistic perception of a gradient commonly employed by some end user applications and photo-editing software.

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.GradientStyle.Horizontal
member.summary: Specifies a gradient from left to right.

remarks.p: The mathematical definition of a horizontal gradient is a linear change as one moves in a horizontal direction. This is the definition exposed by the underlying framework, however developers should be conscious of the fact it may differ from the artistic perception of a horizontal gradient resembling a "horizon," commonly employed in some end user applications and photo-editing software.

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.GradientStyle.BackwardDiagonal
member.summary: Specifies a gradient from upper right to lower left.

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.GradientStyle.ForwardDiagonal
member.summary: Specifies a gradient from upper left to lower right.

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.GradientStyle.HorizontalBump
member.summary: Specifies a gradient that starts with the primary color in the center and migrates toward the secondary color on the left and right.

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.GradientStyle.VerticalBump
member.summary: Specifies a gradient that starts with the primary color in the center and migrates toward the secondary color on the top and bottom.

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.GradientStyle.Circular
member.summary: Specifies a gradient that starts with the primary color in the center point and migrates toward the secondary color on the edges in a circular pattern.

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.GradientStyle.Rectangular
member.summary: Specifies a gradient that starts with the primary color in the center point and migrates toward the secondary color on the edges in a rectangular pattern.

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.GradientStyle.Elliptical
member.summary: Specifies a gradient that starts with the primary color in the center point and migrates toward the secondary color on the edges in a elliptical pattern.

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.GradientStyle.Raise
member.summary: Depricated. Please don't use this.

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.FillHatchStyle.LargeGrid
member.summary: Specifies horizontal and vertical lines that cross at right angles.

remarks.p: This hatch pattern is equivalent to the crossed lines hatch pattern, Cross.

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.FillHatchStyle.DiagonalCross
member.summary: Specifies forward diagonal and backward diagonal lines that cross. The lines are antialiased.

remarks.p: This hatch pattern is equivalent to LargeGrid rotated 45 degrees.

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.FillHatchStyle.Percent05
member.summary: Specifies a 5-percent hatch.

remarks.p: The ratio of foreground color to background color is 1:20.

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.FillHatchStyle.Percent10
member.summary: Specifies a 10-percent hatch.

remarks.p: The ratio of foreground color to background color is 1:10.

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.FillHatchStyle.Percent20
member.summary: Specifies a 20-percent hatch.

remarks.p: The ratio of foreground color to background color is 1:5.

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.FillHatchStyle.Percent25
member.summary: Specifies a 25-percent hatch.

remarks.p: The ratio of foreground color to background color is 1:4.

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.FillHatchStyle.Percent30
member.summary: Specifies a 30-percent hatch.

remarks.p: The ratio of foreground color to background color is 3:10.

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.FillHatchStyle.Percent40
member.summary: Specifies a 40-percent hatch.

remarks.p: The ratio of foreground color to background color is 2:5.

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.FillHatchStyle.Percent50
member.summary: Specifies a 50-percent hatch.

remarks.p: The ratio of foreground color to background color is 1:2.

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.FillHatchStyle.Percent60
member.summary: Specifies a 60-percent hatch.

remarks.p: The ratio of foreground color to background color is 3:5.

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.FillHatchStyle.Percent70
member.summary: Specifies a 70-percent hatch.

remarks.p: The ratio of foreground color to background color is 7:10.

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.FillHatchStyle.Percent75
member.summary: Specifies a 75-percent hatch.

remarks.p: The ratio of foreground color to background color is 3:4.

member.summary: Specifies a 80-percent hatch.

remarks.p: The ratio of foreground color to background color is 4:5.

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.FillHatchStyle.LightDownwardDiagonal
member.summary: Specifies diagonal lines that slant to the right from bottom points to top points and are spaced 50 percent closer together than ForwardDiagonal, but they are not antialiased.

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.FillHatchStyle.LightUpwardDiagonal
member.summary: Specifies diagonal lines that slant to the left from top points to bottom points and are spaced 50 percent closer together than BackwardDiagonal, but they are not antialiased.

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.FillHatchStyle.DarkDownwardDiagonal
member.summary: Specifies diagonal lines that slant to the right from top points to bottom points, are spaced 50 percent closer together than ForwardDiagonal, and are twice the width. This hatch pattern is not antialiased.

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.FillHatchStyle.DarkUpwardDiagonal
member.summary: Specifies diagonal lines that slant to the left from top points to bottom points, are spaced 50 percent closer together than BackwardDiagonal, and are twice its width, but the lines are not antialiased.

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.FillHatchStyle.WideDownwardDiagonal
member.summary: Specifies diagonal lines that slant to the right from top points to bottom points, have the same spacing as ForwardDiagonal, and are triple its width, but are not antialiased.

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.FillHatchStyle.WideUpwardDiagonal
member.summary: Specifies diagonal lines that slant to the left from top points to bottom points, have the same spacing as BackwardDiagonal, and are triple its width, but are not antialiased.

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.FillHatchStyle.LightVertical
member.summary: Specifies vertical lines that are spaced 50 percent closer together than Vertical.

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.FillHatchStyle.LightHorizontal
member.summary: Specifies horizontal lines that are spaced 50 percent closer together than Horizontal.

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.FillHatchStyle.NarrowVertical
member.summary: Specifies vertical lines that are spaced 75 percent closer together than Vertical (or 25 percent closer together than LightVertical).

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.FillHatchStyle.NarrowHorizontal
member.summary: Specifies horizontal lines that are spaced 75 percent closer together than hatch style Horizontal (or 25 percent closer together than LightHorizontal).

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.FillHatchStyle.DarkVertical
member.summary: Specifies vertical lines that are spaced 50 percent closer together than Vertical and are twice its width.

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.FillHatchStyle.DarkHorizontal
member.summary: Specifies horizontal lines that are spaced 50 percent closer together than Horizontal and are twice the width of Horizontal.

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.FillHatchStyle.DashedDownwardDiagonal
member.summary: Specifies dashed diagonal lines, that slant to the right from top points to bottom points.

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.FillHatchStyle.DashedUpwardDiagonal
member.summary: Specifies dashed diagonal lines, that slant to the left from top points to bottom points.

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.FillHatchStyle.DashedHorizontal
member.summary: Specifies dashed horizontal lines.

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.FillHatchStyle.DashedVertical
member.summary: Specifies dashed vertical lines.

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.FillHatchStyle.SmallConfetti
member.summary: Specifies a hatch that has the appearance of confetti.

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.FillHatchStyle.LargeConfetti
member.summary: Specifies a hatch that has the appearance of confetti, and is composed of larger pieces than SmallConfetti.

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.FillHatchStyle.ZigZag
member.summary: Specifies horizontal lines that are composed of zig-zags.

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.FillHatchStyle.Wave
member.summary: Specifies horizontal lines that are composed of wavey tildes.

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.FillHatchStyle.DiagonalBrick
member.summary: Specifies a hatch that has the appearance of layered bricks that slant to the left from top points to bottom points.

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.FillHatchStyle.HorizontalBrick
member.summary: Specifies a hatch that has the appearance of horizontally layered bricks.

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.FillHatchStyle.Weave
member.summary: Specifies a hatch that has the appearance of a woven material.

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.FillHatchStyle.Plaid
member.summary: Specifies a hatch that has the appearance of a plaid material.

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.FillHatchStyle.Divot
member.summary: Specifies a hatch that has the appearance of divots.

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.FillHatchStyle.DottedGrid
member.summary: Specifies horizontal and vertical lines, each of which is composed of dots, that cross.

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.FillHatchStyle.DottedDiamond
member.summary: Specifies forward diagonal and backward diagonal lines, each of which is composed of dots, that cross.

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.FillHatchStyle.Shingle
member.summary: Specifies a hatch that has the appearance of diagonally-layered shingles that slant to the right from top points to bottom points.

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.FillHatchStyle.Trellis
member.summary: Specifies a hatch that has the appearance of a trellis.

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.FillHatchStyle.Sphere
member.summary: Specifies a hatch that has the appearance of spheres laid adjacent to one another.

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.FillHatchStyle.SmallGrid
member.summary: Specifies horizontal and vertical lines that cross and are spaced 50 percent closer together than LargeGrid.

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.FillHatchStyle.SmallCheckerBoard
member.summary: Specifies a hatch that has the appearance of a checkerboard.

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.FillHatchStyle.LargeCheckerBoard
member.summary: Specifies a hatch that has the appearance of a checkerboard with squares that are twice the size of SmallCheckerBoard.

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.FillHatchStyle.OutlinedDiamond
member.summary: Specifies forward diagonal and backward diagonal lines that cross but are not antialiased.

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.FillHatchStyle.SolidDiamond
member.summary: Specifies a hatch that has the appearance of a checkerboard placed diagonally.

member.summary: Enumeration defining interchangeable hinge columns for Candle Chart.

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.HingeColumnType.Open
member.summary: The opening price of a security.

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.HingeColumnType.High
member.summary: The high intraday price of a security.

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.HingeColumnType.Low
member.summary: The low intraday price of a security.

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.HingeColumnType.Close

member.name: T:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.NumericAxisType
member.summary: Numeric scales applicable to continuous chart axes.

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.NumericAxisType.Linear
member.summary: Axis mapping on a linear scale.

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.NumericAxisType.Logarithmic
member.summary: Axis mapping on a logarithmic scale.

remarks.p: To map on a natural logarithmic scale, set LogBase to Math.E. By default, the chart scale on this axis will be on a logarithmic base of 10.

member.name: T:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.AxisRangeType
member.summary: Describes how axis limits are calculated.

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.AxisRangeType.Automatic
member.summary: The charting engine will examine the data and set the upper and lower limits of the Axis based on the maximum and minimum values present in the data source.

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.AxisRangeType.Custom
member.summary: The developer supplies an upper and lower limit for values on the Axis. Data points outside this range are not plotted.

member.name: T:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.StackStyle
member.summary: Style applied to stackable chart types.

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.StackStyle.Normal
member.summary: All the stacked segments ("piles") will have length in proportion to their actual aggregate value.

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.StackStyle.Complete
member.summary: Each segment will be stretched in length such that the "pile" spans the entire chart width (or height).

remarks.p: Use this style when proportionality, not absolute values, is important to the semantic meaning of the chart.

member.name: T:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.LabelRenderLocation
member.summary: Possible locations where a label can render.

remarks.p: This enumeration is used internally by the UltraChart charting infrastructure, and it should not be necessary to access it from application code.

member.name: T:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.ImageFitStyle
member.summary: Background image fitting style.

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.ImageFitStyle.Tiled
member.summary: If background image is smaller than the chart, it will tile the images to cover the whole area.

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.ImageFitStyle.StretchedFit
member.summary: If image is smaller or bigger than the chart, it will be streched or contracted to fit within the chart area.

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.ImageFitStyle.Centered
member.summary: Image will be centered at the center of chart, no scaling or streching will be done to image, and a border may show if the image is smaller than the chart area.

member.summary: Refresh the Adornment cache.
