member.name: T:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.NullHandling
member.summary: Enumerates the possible treatments of Null data points.

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.NullHandling.Zero
member.summary: Null Data will be handled as having zero value.

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.NullHandling.DontPlot
member.summary: Null data points will not be plotted.

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.NullHandling.InterpolateSimple
member.summary: Simple Interpolation is used to plot the null value.

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.NullHandling.InterpolateCustom
member.summary: The InterpolateValues event is raised for custom interpolation of null values.

member.name: T:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.ChartSortType
member.summary: Defines the Sorting Direction for bubbles on BubbleChart.

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.ChartSortType.None
member.summary: No sorting takes place.

remarks.p: This setting is the default and has been provided for backward compatibility.
Developers may continue to sort their data to any criteria desired, with rows appearing later in the data set producing chart elements that render in the foreground.

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.ChartSortType.Ascending
member.summary: Bubbles are sorted by increasing radius.

remarks.p: When bubbles are sorted by increasing radius, larger bubbles percolate into the foreground, in front of smaller bubbles.

member.name: F:Infragistics.UltraChart.Shared.Styles.ChartSortType.Descending
member.summary: Bubbles are sorted by decreasing radius.

remarks.p: When bubbles are sorted by decreasing radius, smaller bubbles percolate into the foreground, in front of larger bubbles.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinChart.IGWinTooltip
member.summary: IGWinTooltip provides tool tips for UltraWinChart.

remarks.p: This control provides tool tips and support for WinTooltipAppearance.
Using IGWinTooltip is a two-step process:

ol.li: Call to set the position where the tool tip is to appear.
Add the appropriate primitives to the graph property.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinChart.IGWinTooltip.#ctor
member.summary: Creates an instance of the tooltip.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinChart.IGWinTooltip.OnPaint(System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs)
member.summary: Paints the tool tip.
member.param: Describes the region requiring painting.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinChart.IGWinTooltip.Dispose
member.summary: Enables the tooltip to perform final clean up before it is released from memory.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinChart.IGWinTooltip.SetLocation(System.Drawing.Point)
member.summary: Sets the location for a tool tip.
member.param: The location of the top-left corner of the tool tip.

remarks.p: Call this method to set the location of a tool tip. The contents must be separately assigned to IGWinTooltip as primitives added to the property.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinChart.IGWinTooltip.Attach(System.Windows.Forms.Control)
member.summary: Attaches IGWinTooltip to a container.
member.param: A parent control.

remarks.p: Attaches IGWinTooltip to a parent control. IGWinTooltip needs to associate itself with controls above UltraWinChart so that the tool tip that renders is not clipped by the bounds of UltraWinChart.

Since the Location properties of parent controls are needed to translate mouse interaction coordinates to chart-relative coordinates, this method also registers this object to receive notifications of the LocationChanged event.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinChart.IGWinTooltip.Detach
member.summary: Detaches IGWinTooltip from a container.

remarks.p: If IGWinTooltip has been attached to a containing top-level control using the method, then calling this method detaches it. After detachment, tool tips may no longer appear at the proper location on the user's screen.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinChart.UltraChart.DataBind
member.summary: Forces the chart data to be refreshed.

remarks.p: When first binding the chart control to a data source, it is necessary to assign a data source to the property and call the DataBind() method.

Normally, the chart will automatically update it's display when it recieves a notification from the that something has changed. However, if the DataSource does not provide this notification, this method can be called to refresh the chart.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinChart.UltraChart.AcceptsFocus
member.summary: Determines whether or not the chart control accepts focus.

remarks.p: Leaving this set to true allows for certain mouse interaction in 3D charts. However, problems can occur when another control requests that focus be sent back to the chart. In these cases, setting AcceptsFocus to False is recommended.

member.summary: Appearance of the hierarchical Drill Down chart behavior.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinChart.UltraChart.PrintDocument
member.summary: Creates and returns a PrintDocument object used for printing the chart.

remarks.p: Each request for this property will result in a new PrintDocument being created, so avoid repeated requests to this Property getter.

The PrintDocument given by this property is returned and no longer referenced by the chart component; therefore, it is the Application's responsibility to dispose of the PrintDocument when it is no longer in use.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinChart.UltraChart.Transform3D
member.summary: Changes the perspective used when displaying a 3-D chart.

remarks.p: 3-D charts can be rotated around their X and Y axes, as well as scaled (moved along the Z axis). The Transform3D property gives you the ability to manipulate the orientation and scaling of the chart to achieve the best perspective on the 3-D data being displayed.
For most charts, there is an optimal range of rotation for X, Y, and Z. This range is as follows:

member.remarks: The cross-hair cursor provides a greater degree of accuracy to assist users when clicking on active segments of the chart, such as individual data points.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinChart.UltraChart.Data
member.summary: Returns a DataAppearance object that can be used to configure the data connection of the chart to the data source.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinChart.UltraChart.DataSource
member.summary: Gets/sets the object which the Chart uses for data.
member.returns: A variety of object types may be specified as the DataSource, see below for details.

remarks.p: The control supports a variety of data source types.

The most robust and extensible data source is the DataTable, which provides update notifications via the IBindingList interface. Use of these built-in ADO.NET data management types offers the greatest flexibility.

Many charts also support data-binding to ICollections (including simple arrays) provided the a single-typed, one-dimensional array can meet the chart type's Data Requirements. Chartable data sources include custom ICollections, and custom data objects that additionally support IBindingList may take advantage of live data-binding to the chart component.
Another data source that may be provided is the local filename of an XML or comma-delimited text file.

XML documents require an internal XML Schema document, and must be readily mappable to the Framework's DataSet (their msdata:IsDataSet attribute is set to true). The schema is also necessary since each XML element must be strongly-typed (otherwise their data type will be inferred as xsd:string and this will not translate readily into a DataSet, even though the data content of the element may be numeric.) Please see the "Generating DataSet Relational Structure from XML Schema" document in the .NET Framework documentation for more on the issues involved, and consult the samples included with this product for working schema.
Data may be unbound from a chart by calling the method.
